string.text: There's a job. We need to find -
Yeah, there's something. We need to find -
Did you find it yet? I need to -
Did you get it? This thing right here -

It seems that the last, seventh part of the documents in Pripyat is missing. However, I got a message from Freedom that one of their groups went missing in the Chernobyl area, and they had a red folder with them - maybe that's what you need. We should try to find them in the vicinity of the power plant. According to Freedom, they were traveling in an APC.

Yeah, I heard that Rat gave you the keys to the old place. You're telling me to put another safe in there? Well, you can, of course. Only, I think you should understand some of the details. First of all, the safe itself - I remember there was one in some hut here near the Bar... let's say I put it together. The safe must have a lock that's in good working order, so that no one will steal anything, because here - people are clever and will do anything to get what they need or to get some quick cash. And most importantly, so that no one steals the safe, it should be magnetized to something so that it doesn't go anywhere. Magnetizing it against wall of the house would work, I'll tell you how. You know about the Magnet artifact, right? Only a few people know this: it has a specific property - if you stick it to something, it'll magnetize it, regardless of what it's made out of. Anyway, I'll help you, but I'll need 5,000 roubles for the job upfront. And I'll need four Magnet artifacts. Do you agree?

Professor:\nThe group we were expecting is now in the Cordon, preparing to evacuate the area. Your job is to go there, and lead the group along the road through the highway to the exit of the area. I'm sending their coordinates, you'll get all the instructions when you get there. Hurry up. Over and out.
An over-the-counter sleep aid. If taken, it'll induce drowsiness quickly.

Informant: Messer, one of the stalker squads has decided to move far into the Zone and explore Silent Hills. Among the squad's stalkers, more than half are elite. They were superbly equipped, can you go see what's wrong with them? Anything you find on them is yours. Just tell me what happened to them, alright? There were three stalkers in the group - two in exoskeletons, one was in a black protective suit, unless of course he'd changed costumes. I know for a fact he's a sniper. They went missing at the village. When you find them, contact me. I'll be waiting for the signal.

Messer, here's the thing, Jackal's been in touch. He sent out an SOS signal. The message he sent was garbled in the transmission, he had something about some 'dark ones'. Bullshit .I spotted him underground in the Cordon area, obviously from the underground tunnels. Why don't you go check it out? You'll get to see each other face to face.

Markov gave some kind of artifact. Near the Bar, a zombified stalker has reappeared in one of the apartment buildings. Markov offered me a job that'll kill two birds with one stone - get rid of a troublesome stalker, and conduct an experiment. We need to plant this artifact next to zombified stalker, which should disintegrate him.
Markov did something with that artifact from the first order. Now we need to expose it to high temperatures.

Major Kravtsov: My brother was forcibly drawn to the killers. He was forced to shoot another stalker, or they would have killed him themselves. There was nothing left for him to do. We need to find him, get him out of the killers' base, then bring him back to our base. Preferably at night, so no one can see you.

Working for the Killers, that's new. Looks like the clan leader wants to cooperate? Then why are the others hostile? Too many questions. Nevertheless, you need to kill the stalker at the MedPribor Research Institute. He's hiding in the underground. The leader gave me a tip: the basement of the Research Institute can be accessed through the underground of the Garbage so you don't get too irradiated - the direct path to the MedPribor Research Institute's basement has dangerous levels of radiation.

We got a tip from Lone Wolf. He made it clear that they wouldn't just let me into the bar. We need to get some documents from the Dark Valley. This will be my fee for passing into the circle of experienced stalkers. There's some crazy psionic energy at the Dark Valley, we need protection. Lone Wolf told me about a special helmet you can get from the military, near the creek in the Garbage.
Toad's information about the lower levels of the Garbage

According to Toad, he once saw a group of scientists in the Garbage a long time ago. They walked around, measured something, and went off toward the hangar, apparently into the basement rooms. Then, once under, the blowout hit them, and may still be lying there by the railway tunnel in a hole at the Garbage. Maybe I can find something from them that can open up access to the lower levels. You'll need an access code. Toad said that if I got in and found anything interesting and brought it to him, he will pay.

Looks like we managed to find Gunslinger's stash, but it looks like there's nothing of value here... Found some book - it had a note in it that said where an PDA was stashed behind the main scientific complex of the MedPribor Research Institute in the basement. We should try to find it.

Yeah, one more thing - there's a job. In that place, in the hangars, there's a passageway. There, deep underground, on the lower level of the tunnels, the stalkers discovered a large metal gate. Scans have confirmed that there are large rooms behind the gates. Come on, go downstairs and see what's going on. Report back to me later. I'm uploading any information about the entry point to those rooms into your PDA.
News and events in the Zone
A request from the leader of Clear Sky

Winds of Madness... what does it all mean? Anyway, apparently the road to the center of the Zone goes through Lake Yantar, and there's a certain scientist at Yantar - someone going by the nickname of Professor. He's the one who's going to have to help me with this, but I don't know if he'll want to help me. To get what I need, I'll have to work for Professor first.

Discovered a strange mutant. It looks like a meter maid, only more disfigured. Maybe we can find something interesting to do with this mutant. Something tells me this mutant isn't just a simple mindless goon, there's something else going on.

We need to investigate the underground utilities beneath the Cordon. Before me, a group of stalkers had already disappeared there. You need to find some interesting thing for Toad from there and bring it to the Cordon.

Docent handed out a prototype of a device that protects your brain if you're exposed to a blowout without shelter. But, in order for him to finish his work, this prototype must be laid out in the open while a blowout is occuring. Doing this without any sort of protection is dangerous business.
This is the road to the Big City. It's closed now, the radiation levels are too high. That's where that radio program was from. You don't want to go that way right now.

The journalist is missing. I need to go north and find him, but first, we need to visit his apartment in Shining Path - Doctor gave us a tip-off: he used to live in Shining Path for a while, so I might be able to find something at where he used to live. Maybe I can find something.

Everything seems ready for the trek north. The people from Duty should be waiting at Radar by now. My window of opportunity is from 9 PM to 11 PM.I need to break into the lab and shut down the Woodpecker before time runs out. After that, in theory, the road to Pripyat will be open.

Next assignment from Toad: you need to find some kind of artifact on the tower that is at the railroad bridge and bring it to him. I need to remember to use the detector... damn, the battery in it is almost drained.

Got the gun from Toad. It's in rough shape, but at least it's something. I have to go down the road, and then go to the underpass. There's a stalker waiting for me there, I think I'll need to take someone down with him, or something.

Looks like another errand. On the roof of the factory, the Flesh that we've slaughtered has made a lair there. Toad says there are documents located there. We should find them and bring them to him. If I don't get the documents, he won't talk to me.

This is serious business - I need need to rescue the commander that was leading a patrol and get him to safety. He's located at the factory where the SOS signal is coming from. I need to check my gear and first aid kits, and a grenade from Toad would be nice.
After the recent emission, another Toad's Eye artifact appeared in the Garbage. I need to find it and bring it to Toad. He gave me the coordinates. I wonder why no one wants to go after it?

Toad sent me a message that says a stalker going by the nickname 'Boar' knows something about Gunslinger. He's located at the northern checkpoint at the Garbage - the one manned by Duty. I need to talk to him, and then go back to Toad. Toad also mentioned something about an eye artifact that Boar has, he wants it for whatever reason.

Damn, this sucks. Woke up in a strange place. That Toad is a very shady man. He wants me to work off what I owe him, fine. I need to pick up a crate from the bench in the merchant's bunker, and then take it to the roadblock. There's a crate containing something that Toad wants at the roadblock - the decoy crate should fool the grunts at the roadblock.

This is my first serious, real outing. I need to be well prepared. It's probably not a good idea to go alone, either. I need to try and find someone at the Cordon who will agree to go to the Research Institute with me. It's worth talking to the locals, see if anyone will agree. Well, if not, I guess I take my own chances.
Talk to the leader of Duty
On my way out of Shining Path, I received a message from the leader of the Duty faction. I need to talk to him.

Informant sent me a message with a request. He wants me to find some kind of gravity-based device, supposedly made by some Burers, that's located somewhere within the basements of the MedPribor Research Institute some and bring it to him.

Well, I guess the truth is out there. Now I can power down the mythical Black Monolith. I need to go down to the lower levels of the lab under Radar, and get to the control room of the installation. The lower door access code is 5489.

I need to provide covering fire for the Yantar scientists that are leaving via helicopter. Professor gave some kind of rifle that must be returned after the mission is finished. Also, I can't go to the nearby village and attract attention to myself by shooting everything that moves - I'll have to do this quietly.

Professor gave me an assignment to catch a live Flesh specimen. How on earth am I going to do this? The hell he knows. It's probably gonna take a lot of running, Fleshes are fickle and cowardly creatures. According to these coordinates, there's a Flesh at one of the houses at Bright Beam.

Professor said that a car with a load from the Big Land was driving to the mobile base. His radio communication with it was cut right at the entrance to the Exclusion Zone at the Cordon. I need to find the scientist and deliver the cargo to Professor. He didn't say anything about the cargo itself, but since his colleague was traveling by car, delivering the cargo on foot could be problematic.

The science bunker at Yantar is experiencing food supply problems. It's necessary to bring them food so I can continue to cooperate with them further. I think ten cans of food will be enough for them. It's worth talking to Toad, maybe he can sell large bulk orders of food.

Professor needs a measurement of air infected with spores from a certain parasite. In order to do this, I'll have to deploy this device given to me by Professor near any corpse infected with the parasite and then return it to him once it collects the data it needs.

The backpack from a stalker's kit. You can use it as a stash for loot, but you can't fit much in it. Also, you need to consider the fact that it can be stolen, so you should hide it in a secluded place.

When I was born, the Zone already existed. It's true, the old people said that there was a time that the town they lived in was outside the Zone, but I don't remember that. There are legends that somewhere there is some 'Big Land' or huge city, that's where the helicopters come from sometimes and the new stalkers come from. But something happened there a few years ago. Maybe the visiting stalkers know something more specific about this 'Big Land'.

Gunslinger, he also came from the outside, they say he was an important figure in the outside world, but nobody really knows anything. There were even rumors that fanatics from the Sin Clan believed that something important depended on him. Maybe he was thrice-born, too?

Goplit knew something about him, we're from the same village. He always wanted to be a writer, he said he loved the fantasy genre. He's told me about heroes that always acted justly, and even if they were lonely, still defeated evil in the end. Goplit said something about the Journalist, the latter was looking for something, and Goplit bragged that he had found it - but whether he gave it to the Journalist or not, I don't know.

Alright, don't ramble on, we'll get to your base, see what you accidentally grabbed. In the meantime, I should get something to eat, because I've forgotten when I've had anything in my mouth other than knocked out teeth. You didn't grab anything but folders in that archive?

Hmmm.. I'm a business man. You're looking for Gunslinger, aren't you? I have information about him. If you do a job for me first, I'll tell you what I know about him - pro quid pro. Also, you're right about the radiation. But, that fugitive we're looking for is hiding in the basements of the research institute - there's no radiation there... I mean, in case you didn't know. The underground tunnels in the Garbage are connected to the MedPribor Research Institute underground, so if you go that way, you won't need the suit.. in theory. If you agree to do this, I'll give you information about the underground section of the MedPribor Institute.
Some scientist on the roof of Bar asked me if it's possible to find this artifact. He only gave me a photo of it without any description or relevant information.

It's an unremarkable folder. You can tell from the cover that it has been used more than once, but all the sheets inside are laminated and uncharacteristically thick. The content is impressive - it's nothing short of a psi helmet assembly manual. Even at a cursory glance, it can be seen that each sheet is designed with the utmost care so that it can be understood by a knowledgeable professional. From the sketches and attached photos, it can be understood that the device is not particularly difficult to assemble, but, judging from the numerous notes and attached experimental results, requires a certain knowledge of neurobiology and cybernetics for fine-tuning, as well as rare or difficult-to-make parts for the helmet that are required for it to work correctly.

Your PDA found a message for someone named Major: R-138, there's a new order from our friends at command. An important one. There's a rumor that a Frankenstein stalker has been seen in the Zone. The Doctor put it together from other stalkers' body parts, literally. We can't get to the Doctor in the Swamps - the high psi activity there prevents us from reaching his home, but the Frankenstein stalker himself is still wandering around the Zone somewhere. Find him and bring him to the checkpoint. Alive, if possible. I already gave my soldiers the stalker's description. But you have a better chance of finding him. Send the number of the account - I'll pay in advance, if you agree.
A notebook with personal notes in it
The major's using everyone he can to find him. Killers... dark... The Doctor, his masterful work... put together a few pieces... We can't let the Major find him... you can't.

I can help with that, but the result won't be immediate. You'll have to make inquiries, asking who's been where, when.. and one more thing. There are two options you can choose from.\nSo the first... if you give me two thousand roubles, I'll send you the approximate location of the document you're interested in a little while to your PDA.\nThe second option will cost you more: I'm the one who's pulling my strings and getting you the document you need. All you have to do is come and get it from me. It will cost more ten grand total. So, what do you need to find?

Test results of the Posthuman Project.\nIn the document folder, you can find a sheet with the title "conclusion" on it. The sheet says, "Based on the results, the following conclusions can be drawn: 1) the project is still too far from completion, 2) we should focus on finding a method that combines both the intelligence enhancement of the test material and the effective maximization of external cortex radiation, 3) we should involve the neuroengineering department in the project to consult on the issue of psi overload."
Exchange for a code to the lab

The leader of one of the bandit groups in the Dark Valley has agreed to give the password to enter the lab. In exchange for this information, he wants an VSK-94 rifle, and five bottles of vodka. If I can't get him five bottles of vodka, five jars will do. He also asked me to say hello to Informant at the Bar.

A large pile of papers with various records in it.\nIn order to make research work safer and more stable (after several unfortunate incidents), it was decided to administer a third kind of psi-influence to all laboratory workers, from cleaners to scientists. Everyone will be fitted with adaptable psi-blocks that will prevent anyone from disrupting operations, rioting, stealing data, and pogroms or escapes.\nMessage: ...there was a conflict between a group of scientists developing psychotropic weapons and the leaders of Project Cover-up. Scientists did not want to be exposed to the rays of the weapons they themselves were developing. Realizing that it's only a matter of time before they become victims the weapons they're working on, the scientists began to ponder the situation and came up with a plan to free themselves from danger.
Cooked meat. This meat is entirely safe to eat.

The development of psychotronic weapons initiated in the USSR led to the creation of the 'OSOZNANIE' (or Common Consciousness) project in 2006, the laboratories of which are located in the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone. The idea of the project is to influence the information layer of Earth, the "noosphere", through which it is possible to influence any individual on the planet. A group of scientists, guided by presumably humane considerations, not excluding, however, parties with potentially malicious intentions working behind the scenes - starting developing machinery and began experiments that allows, in their opinion, to stop violence, war, crime and so on. This idealistic experiment lead to the deformation of the essence of the universe, the consequences of which lead to the birth of the Zone. Realizing the fact that something unintended is happening, but at the same time realizing that it is up to them to stop the consequences, the participants of the experiment block the passage to the Center of the Zone with psi-fields, and created a mythical Wish Granter, located under the sarcophagus of the Chernobyl Nuclear Power plant, which is actually a "Monolith" psi-installation, causing halluciogenic visions, in the form of the apparent realization of an individual's desires. Also, the group uses psionic energy to influence the leaders various post-Soviet states to prevent massive attacks with their armies, which could lead to the destruction of the generators, which still give a chance to return everything to normal. Plus, they force representatives of the authorities to prevent people from entering the Zone in every possible way (military stalkers, cordons, etc). People who have reached the center of the Zone and fallen under the influence of "Monolith", form either squads of zombie defenders, or wipe their memories and take them far away from the center of the Zone, or send the hardiest to eliminate undesirable people, both in the Zone and outside it. This procedure of total zombification or control is codenamed S.T.A.L.K.E.R., and operatives who are made using this method are designated as such with a tattoo. Gunslinger is one of these operatives. He realistically learned too much to be left alive, but any complex system can fail, so in his case, instead of being eliminated, he was zombified and sent to kill himself. And only the fact that he seems to have an innate ability to easily tolerate exposure to certain amounts of psionic energy has led me to the conclusion that he is still acting sensibly.
Transmitter Main Module Control Access Card.
Experimental T-ZUD-12 prototype (ultra pressure protection). Faulty, but it might have some value to someone.
A device for shielding against the effects of psionic emission on the body. It'll give complete protection, but it has a limited lifespan.

A sample of special equipment that's used to measure psionic energy from a blowout. Scientists have discovered that during an emission in the Zone, there is a strange psionic energy activity, so it's necessary to find out the nature of this phenomena. To measure, the device must be laid out in an open area during an emission.

When the commotion started, I accidentally got into some room, they didn't lock a damn thing in there, they must have been sure no one would get in. There's some sort of archive, I took as many folders as I could fit into my duffel bag. I don't know why, but they're prized in the Zone. The Watchdog wouldn't let us trade information. Maybe he was dealing it himself. I can't understand the content of these papers, but you can sell them for good money, which means I'll be able to eat.

RGO (GRAU index - 7G22) - hand-held, anti-personnel grenade. This grenade is designed for defensive combat. Like all hand-held grenades, it's meant to be thrown at whatever is trying to harm you. The dispersal range of its fragmentation is 50 meters, and its potential damage radius is 100 meters. The RGO grenade is similar to the F-1 grenade, but it differs from F-1 by the use of a combined percussion and remote fuze, meaning that it'll explode once it hits a hard surface. The RGO's fuze is highly durable, detonating regardless of the surface inclination or position of the grenade. The fuze is cocked 1.3 to 1.8 seconds after the spoon is released, which eliminates the possibility of accidentally setting it off by dropping the RGO grenade unintentionally. If the grenade is not detonated by its percussion fuze, then the grenade will self-destruct by detonation after 3.2 to 4.2 seconds pass once the spoon has been released. If the RGO grenade doesn't use its percussion fuze, then it'll just work like an F-1, RG-42, or RGD-5 grenade. RGO grenades normally have an olive green color, while the version of it that's meant for training is colored black.

The mediator was generally unsociable, so I don't know about his affairs. He rarely came here, and if he did, he wasn't here for long. He was often seen at Yantar because he was testing something for the scientists there before. He came to the bar today, about an hour before his body was found. Before he died, he asked about all sorts of things - including questions about you.

The last person who talked to him was Sanya Borov. Things weren't the warmest between them, you know. I once heard that the mediator ditched Sanya for some loot when they went to the Garbage. They just had another scandal today, and I had to kick them out. So far, all suspicions fall on Sanya, especially since he wanted to get away when he was found at the murder scene.

Maybe someone's trying to cover their tracks by using your name. I think Khmyr was hanging around the table where Sanya was standing. Where he is now, I don't know. He left when the trouble started, which makes him suspicious. I should talk to the Informant about this. Hubby was just talking to him.

I've been there, up north. I went through the Incinerator. I spent three days hiding from Monolith soldiers, in basements. Then back I went and got caught in a blowout. I've been hit by blowouts twice already, I'm all messed up. I've been told there's a clinic in the 'Big Land', where they treat this kind of thing, fixing your brain. Yet, here I am, I'm still alive.

Not all items found in the Zone of Alienation are safe. Weapons, food, artifacts, objects, everything can be exposed to radioactive contamination.
Any individual object, even in a backpack, can absorb radiation if you enter an area that has heightened levels of background radiation. Be sure to carry a dosimeter or detector.
With a dosimeter, you can check if an object is contaminated. Just look it over in the backpack. If it's contaminated, the dosimeter will beep.
Now, a little bit about radiation sickness.
It is possible to get radiation sickness by staying in areas with high levels of radioactive contamination, or by eating contaminated food. It'll manifest as a permanent decline in health and stamina. On top of that, your vision will get a yellowish haze. The worse the contamination, the higher the negative effects.
It can only be fought by taking large quantities of anti-rads, vodka, and some scientists seem to be able to cure this ailment.
You can keep an eye on the contamination rate by getting checked out by scientists. They may have already made some sort of diagnostic device.
Toad, 05/21/2007.

Messer, are you in the village right now? I need you to check out something for me: a hobo from the Garbage was bringing me a package from the Bar, but he disappeared somewhere around here. Look around and see if you can find him, or his package. If you find anything, bring it to me right away.
What are you doing out there?

I took Mediator's container. He didn't want to share it nicely. I had to... do the wrong thing. I've dealt with it, but the container won't open. It's locked, and only a certain code will open it. Man, I should go back to our meeting place. We should have gotten the code to that thing before we took him down. If I can open it. I'll be cured.

A PDA, or Personal Data Assistant, is a pocket-sized personal computer. The owner of this PDA didn't bother deleting their recent messages. One of the latest PDA messages is from the owner of an stalker hideout: 'He's moving North. He was last seen at the Garbage. You need to follow him and make sure he doesn't make it to the center of the Zone. Don't go to Pripyat, it's a dead end. If he goes to Pripyat, come back - the soldiers stationed there will finish him off.'

Subject has located passage 1 and 3, protruding into sector 28.
Teams White, Green to Sector 26 for evacuation.
Groups Red: go to the Dark Valley, and go to the laboratory sector there, and find the exit to the Cordon dungeons.
Groups Blue reports that three samples of anomalous formations #24 were found at the Cordon. These formations were reported to be in the vicinity of the factory entrance, near the water tower, and near an destroyed building in the village.
To all groups: The backup weapons stash is located at the Radar, and information about it has been attached to this message. Use only when absolutely necessary.
Contact the major about the facility.

Electrical supply data.
Data about the presence of a powerful source of electric generator directly behind the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant.
The data has been corrupted.
Backup code for the entrance to the lower level of the energy center located in the underground segment of the facility at Radar- Data corrupted

I had a strange dream. The hulk of the Chernobyl plant, shrouded in darkness. Everything looks peaceful. A lone man appears. I can see him from the back against the power plant. The wind is starting to blow. Suddenly, a sea of rats starts scattering away from the power plant in different directions. A man standing with his back to me, shooting rats. Suddenly, the man in the dream shouts out "Gunslinger!". Then the man flinches, freezes for a moment and slowly starts to turn towards me, but I wake up the moment before I get to see his face What does this dream mean? I don't know, but I think it's something I've seen before.
Your PDA's battery charge is almost drained
An air analyzer that's set up to analyze parasite spores. To activate this device, you must deploy it near a source of spores.
Watch out! You're right next to the anomalies. Use your bolts to determine where they're located.
Universal energy module that's meant for psionic weapons.
Personalized access card. Often used by scientists and security personnel to control access to certain areas.
An RGD-5 grenade that has been enhanced with a Gravi artifact. It draws in enemies after it detonates, and then propels them away, making this grenade considerably more dangerous.
An F-1 grenade that has been enhanced with a Gravi artifact. It draws in enemies after it detonates, and then propels them away, making this grenade considerably more dangerous.
When this knife stabs any anyone, or anything, it's repulsed away by the anomalous energy imbued in the knife.
Personalized access card. Often used by scientists and security personnel to control access to certain areas.
I remember everything! Give the Winds of Madness cyclicity chart to Messer. He has to go!
Documents about "Winds of Madness", with some notes from Professor attached (Winds of Madness Cyclicity Chart)

It seems that someone attempted to burn this file. There's soot on the cover, and various pages have burnt corners. There are also sheets detailing records of experiments conducted in the Zone with various notes from Professor attached. On the back of some chart, a message to Messer is written in the Professor's handwriting. 
 "Messer, forgive me. I've devoted my whole life to science. I believed in progress and its good for humanity. I set great goals for myself, but now I see where my actions have led. I didn't want this. I am sorry you have to live in this world, but there is nothing I can do to make up for my mistakes. Go to the North - there you will find the answers to all your questions. Thanks to these papers, I was able to calculate the exact amount of time it takes for the installation that keeps stalkers out of the center of the Zone to cool down. You can turn off the installation by sneaking in to the maintenance lab when it's not running at full capacity. The cooling phase begins at 9 PM and lasts about two hours. But even at this time, the installation is still active, so you can't get close without psi protection. 
 I hope I was able to help you in some way. Please don't blame me for what I did. But now I can't rest easy seeing the "marvelous new" world I had a hand in. Go North, Messer. You need to go." 
 Professor
It's alright, come on in. We're just waiting for you.
[A huge amount of information is not readily available. It appears to be a mishmash of code that's impossible to understand until someone deciphers it.]
Disconnect the power supplied by the power plant
The power to the unit is turned off
Emergency containment of the complex has been deactivated

It seems that someone attempted to burn this file. There's soot on the cover, and various pages have burnt corners. There are also sheets detailing records of experiments conducted in the Zone. If Sin's leader locked this file in a safe, there was a reason. Also in the folder is a draft of a letter whose recipient is V.M. Chubko. It says: 
 "Just got back from testing the Kaymanov rig. Not only were the drugs not distributed to everyone, but the biological material is walking around the building unguarded. There's a clear lack of safety in plain sight. Installing it is no good at all. Also, I've been tallying up the total cost and needs of the equipment and cooling system. I'm already studying their blueprints (don't ask me how I got them, you won't believe me anyway). I'll send them to you with the letter so you can see for yourself. This installation requires a nuclear power plant nearby, so you can forget about any mobility. And if its lockup overheats, the whole rig will get out of control and start messing with everyone's brains indiscriminately. If you want to normally secure the Center Lab from foreign elements, use ours. 
 However, the choice is yours. If you want to have a problematic transmitter at your side, have it, Vladimir Mikhailovich. But I'm not responsible for the consequences. Next time I will send a formal complaint to the Panel for consideration." 
 Prikhodko P.S.
Turn on the complex's emergency lighting
The complex's emergency lighting is on
Open the front door to the complex
A tablet with a hand-drawn map of the Zone.

Anomalies are small areas of the Zone in which the laws of physics that are familiar to everyone no longer apply. Anomalies produce artifacts - various kinds of items with unique properties that stalkers hunt for. Anomalies, along with mutants, are a key feature that distinguishes the Zone from the rest of the surface of planet Earth. Features:
- spawn artifacts when monsters die in them
- can be deactivated when spawning an artifact
- can be deactivated by specialized equipment
- deactivated anomalies are reactivated after an emission occurs

Features:
- to get all of the information about the properties of an artifact, you need a information about the relevant artifact downloaded to your PDA
- certain artifacts may have different prices and weight, depending on the sample
- the properties of an artifact may change after a blowout
- artifacts lose their properties when used
- a fully discharged artifact loses its properties

Features:
- some mutants are afraid of fire and psionic energy
- some non-mutated animals, such as rats and crows are edible (they can also be specially cooked on a campfire)
- some mutants have certain tissue samples that may be of interest to traders and scientists (you'll need relevant information about what kind of sample to collect downloaded to your PDA)

Don't worry, and don't you dare threaten me here. The Dutyers have an interest in my work, and I'm not afraid of anything. They'll protect me if they have to. Anyway, you said you came by to say hello? Hmm. You're a stalker, huh? I can see from your face that you're clearly an experienced man, you must have seen a lot. When you're out in the Zone, bring me one of these if you get a chance. This is, so to speak - my main object of study here in general. I've sent a photo of what I'm looking for to your PDA. I'll pay you well for your trouble, don't worry. This thing is rare, it doesn't come along very often, and I need it. Take care.

Would you believe me if I told you what organization I'm from? Ha, I'm not sure you would. The fact that you got the artifact really speaks volumes about you - at least for me. I think you and I have a business relationship to continue. Here, here's 500 roubles. Anyway, you want to know more about that artifact you got for me? It's not easy to study it. Although it does appear in the Zone, its true properties I do not yet know. All I know is that it's not a simple little trinket. There's something hidden in it, something beyond our understanding. Yeah, something like certainly sounds commonplace here in the Zone, but this artifact is a truly unique specimen in terms of its potential... Tell you what, come see me in a day. I will do some experiments with this sample. Afterwards, if you come back, I'll pay you twice as much for your next assignment.

And the fact that even with partial activation, it was possible to do.. something with this artifact. That's what you're going to find out - you need to do a practical experiment. Here, take a sample. You need to do a full activation of this artifact. How do you do that? It's very simple. It needs to be exposed to ultra-high temperatures. I don't know the neighborhood much, so I have no idea where to get a heat source higher than a hundred or two degrees around here. You've seen a lot of things, haven't you? In general, throw the sample in some place with elevated ambient temperature and see what happens. Then report back to me what you see. As promised, I'll pay twice as much as last time. Alright, go, I'll wait for the results.

The PDA battery is almost dead. I think this is the last note I'm going to make. I don't know how long I've exactly been here, but I think it's possible to get out, because you can hear sounds from the other side. It's like being behind a wall. There's a lot of people walking around. I've been yelling, but no one seems to have heard me yet. I think I'm gonna make it out. I heard the one from the death truck slipping me something, he's the reason I'm here. It's okay, when I get out of here, I'll tell everyone what he is. And the General.. they thought I don't know. The main thing is to get out before I run out of food and water. I'll tell everyone. Gunslinger said, s...
Starting/turning off the engine - Z. Controls: WASD. Shifting gears - LCtrl, LShift.
Handbrake - Space. Headlights - L. Door - T. Trunk - F.
You need some gasoline and an battery.

Psychotropic influence and zombification on a global scale
1. Invisible and imperceptible influence. General emphases on behavior in large masses of people (cities).
2. Impact on underground political groups.
3. Creating a favorable environment for the official introduction of planetary-scale psionic effects. Statewide correction of people's psyche, mood and mental state.
4. Direction the attention of the masses in order to hide and disguise information about psychotropic research. This will be caused by an artificial loss of interest in parapsychology.
5. There are psionic keys at major cities that will turn up to 50% of the population into biorobots.
6. The first steps (successful tests of large-scale influence at the state level) - mass transition to the old currency (Soviet rubles).

Controllers are ex-humans with various augmentations done with surgical and biochemical brain changes. They have the ability to control other living organisms using microlepton brainwaves (simply put, telepathy). They are normally dressed in semi-sporty tight-fitting uniforms, predominantly black in color. Here is some general information about what they do:
1. Controllers are completely mute and do not commnicate verbally.
2. They capture and zombify any stalkers that are known to have any important documents that could compromise our work.
3. They will stop any attempts by researchers to penetrate to the center of the Zone.
4. They will control the mutants of the Zone
5. They will set up psionic energy generators to zombify animals and humans.
6. They are generally nocturnal and prefer to operate at night. However, Controllers are quite capable during the day.
All major takedowns are conducted at night. Factions Roadblock 7. Lastly, they know that they can't attack or attempt to control military stalkers.

Beneath the ground lies the bodies of the Common Consciousness project group. They're all in a near-coma state. There's a certain body in the underground lab that controls all of the other ones. It carries out their will, controls external processes, and provides their bodies with everything they need. It is the representative of the Common Consciousness project, children were "harvested" by Common Consciousness to prepare a more powerful replacement.

You're leaving after all, eh? Even though the old man refused to give you his notes on the cyclical nature of the Winds of Madness. No offense to him, but he's been here in the Zone for a hell of a long time. The Zone, she's like a... What can you compare the Zone to without leaving the Zone? Only with the Zone itself.

I don't take offense. I've got some paperwork right here. I picked them up at the Sin's lair. Maybe you could use them for something. Everything I need to know I already know, and what's missing to complete the picture is not in them anyway, Give it to the professor. I need to go.

We all, in one form or another, try to forget anything that involves strong negative emotions or stress. Otherwise, a person simply won't survive under our circumstances. If the stress is great, or maybe it's the global influences, or geofactors... or..

What about happiness? Which one of you is happier? By the way, there's a town not far away, and only zombies live there. What about wish fulfillment? Who's desires and perception of reality are in a more harmonious relationship?

However, you are quite drowsy, young man. No, by the external world I mean the world outside of a person, as opposed to their internal world. Although in some ways it can be compared to the Zone as well. So, what makes you so sure that everything you see and feel is actually happening, that your perception is in accordance with the surrounding reality and not induced by this very surrounding reality? Take the zombies for example - do you think they see the world the same way you do?

That depends on how you look at the question, young man. Once upon a time I worked in one of the famous institutes dealing with management problems, we had a modest laboratory there. Actually, what do you know about our perception of information from the outside world?

No, I'm certainly convinced that this is the real artifact - something that doesn't exist. But! In principle, its existence does not contradict my hypothesis about the interaction of complex geofactors that somehow acquire completely new properties, which are almost impossible to predict from the properties of the constituent objects of the system.

Yes. Once, it was a big research camp, volunteers came here, equipment was delivered, but we were forgotten over time. First, the influx of volunteers stopped - something in the outside world began to fail.

What's there to talk about when there's stuff going on here in the Zone? This is where every normal scientist should be. It's certainly a shame that there has been a complete cessation of any supply. Our lab now works under an autonomous system. Young employees gradually began to go to other places, some of them joined some stalker clans, someone disappeared in the depths of the Zone. Some of them have died trying to get artifacts, and some others have become a sort of a legend in the Zone. Like the Mad Doctor, for example. He was one of the employees of one of the labs here in the Zone, but it was as if he had become part of the Zone. He developed characteristics not found in a normal person. No, he's not a mutant in the literal sense of the word, but there's something special about him. They say he can heal stalkers crippled by the Zone - literally, from bits and pieces. Or even one of the remains of several. He's also supposedly able to communicate with zombies and even bring them back to normal. However, it's also said that he does this very rarely, as he believes that zombies do not want to return to normal life at all. We also had a guy named, uh.. Journalist, I think. He was obsessed with some sort of international conspiracy idea. He was babbling about globalists most of the time, stating that they brought kids to the Zone for some reason.

They say there are some, but nobody really knows anything. I think there is such an order - a close-knit group of people trying to maintain the status quo. They are also called Angels of the Zone, or adherents of the Monolith cult. They guard the center from which, according to rumors, the general management of all life in the Zone is carried out.
The personal PDA of a stalker nicknamed Goplit. Its password-protected, so you can't access its contents. Maybe one of the scientists can crack it.

I didn't have time to do a write-up the day before yesterday. I came across Journalist in the swamp nearby. I had to carry him back to his nest and help him get back up on his feet. The Zuda I was saving for Toad had to be wasted. It's alright, it was worth using it to save Journalist. He said he was running away from someone, but when I asked who exactly was chasing him, he preferred to keep silent. Bid him farewell today - he's scooted off somewhere up north. Where exactly and why - I don't know, but apparently he is going to meet his informants there. Before he left, he asked me if I had visited the archives of the local research institute. He was interested in some papers related to the delivery of equipment to the laboratory at Radar. I'll be in the neighborhood to check it out. In case I find anything, I'll tell Journalist when I meet him.
A rat that's been cooked with fire. Its much more nutritious than a uncooked rat, and the heat from the fire has sterilized it, making it safe to eat.
A crow that's been cooked with fire. Its much more nutritious than a uncooked crow, and the heat from the fire has sterilized it, making it safe to eat.
A box of matches. You can use these to start a fire. A campfire can be used to keep warm at night or in the rain, cook food, and scare off hostile monsters.

...the Common Consciousness experiments were a success. The linkage of the five prisoners yielded positive results. "Common Consciousness" or "C-consciousness" had slightly mental power than five times human intelligence. "C-consciousness" awakened, showing frantic neuron activity and almost five times (compared to the human brain) the speed of information processing. The criminals' previously erased memory was being filled in again...[no data]...the precautions were insufficient. The researchers were not prepared for this kind of eventuality. Unintended contact with one of the group's sedated bodies part of the "C-consciousness" project was made; two technicians and a nurse on the maintenance staff came under control of the five minds linked to C-consciousness. Next, the entire research block where the experiment was being conducted came under control with incredible speed. Reacting quickly, the experiment managers completely isolated the entire unit from the outside world. Deadly gas was pumped through the ventilation shafts. 28 controlled bodies were thrashing around in convulsions while C-consciousness tried unsuccessfully to find an escape route. It was calculating escape options, scanning the bodies memory. They began to perish, but C-consciousness had already discovered one-way windows through which a group of scientists were observing the effects of the experiment. With the help of strong telepathic influence, the group was brought under control and the C-consciousness was held back by nothing. The staff of the underground complex was taken under control, the power of C-consciousness increased manifold. About 500 people are connected to C-consciousness..

Hmm. I don't really need any artifacts, but I do need some parts. Tell you what, if you get me a Killer suit, a specialized protective suit meant for scientists, a P90, and five bottles of vodka.. then I'll give it to you. I'll hold it for you. If you don't want to get me all of that stuff, I'll give you what you want for ten grand.

This drug relieves the effects of various kinds of psionic radiation. It surpasses other benzodiazepine and abenzodiazepine tranquilizers in terms of how strong it is; it has a very strong anxiolytic (anti-anxiety) and tranquilizing effect; it also has a pronounced anticonvulsant, myorelaxant (muscle relaxant) and sedative effect.
A pill blister pack with a single dose of Chloroquine in it. Chloroquine gives protection against rabies. Most dogs in the Zone are infected with rabies, and will spread it if they attack anyone.
This servo power cell is meant for exoskeletons. In order to supply an exoskeleton with power, you must attach this power cell to your belt.

This suit was made by the stalker who gives by the name 'Golmar'. It has various particles from artifacts embedded in its fabric, giving it useful anomalous properties. Pieces from an gravity artifact have been sewn into this suit's flaps, allowing its user to hover slightly above the ground, increasing height its user can jump, and potentially softening the impact from long falls. This suit also increases its user's carrying capacity by an additional 20 kilograms.
A false eye that's made of glass.
This glass eye that belongs to a stalker named Phil has the code 667 engraved on it. You might want to remember this code.
The code on Phil's glass eye.

The repairman at the Bar will exchange a suit that belonged to a stalker named Golmar for the following items:
Killer suit
EX-04 Scientific suit
P90 submachine gun
Five bottles of vodka.
Ten thousand rubles.

Diary of a Dead Stalker. Some of the pages are blurred due pages getting smuged with purge caused by cadaverous decomposition, but some of them are still readable.
02.04.2012 ...agreed to an expedition into the city. Maybe even borrow their science suit. In the meantime, I'll go like this, it's not a bad jacket. Oh, yeah, I remember, there's a locked room behind a closet in the ruins. When I'm in town, I should go in there. It's a little hard to get to that closet, though.
03.04.2012 Got to Freedom Base. It was just Chrome and a couple of his security guys. He said that the zombies before the blowout in the city are beastly, and it's better to hide somewhere an hour or two before the blowout starts. Well, I'll keep that in mind.
02.04.2012, 23.40 Found that damn apartment Professor was talking about. Yeah, it looks like one of them used to be here. I've only got a few spare batteries left. Anyway, I've changed up my PDA, and now I'm going to sleep here. Thankfully, the switch at the door is still working.
03.04.2012, 03.14. Woke up to a knock on the door. Through the gap I spotted three zombies. They're trying to break in. Hopefully they'll be gone by morning at least.
03.04.2012, 08.45. They don't want to leave. They can smell me. Fucking hell, I'll try to get through.
03.04.2012, 12.31. Yeah, it's been a pretty bad day. One of those rotten zombies bit through my jacket. The wound is covered in white foam. This sucks.
03.04.2012, 16.05 PDA's dead. Huh, I was gonna buy a spare battery from the Barkeep...
03.04.2012, 20.15 It's getting dark. Just this red light, and howling zombies. The wound hurts. Covered in sores. Why did I come here?
04.04.2012, 03.55. The door won't budge at all. And they're just standing there, waiting.
04.04.2012, 5.45. A couple of stalkers passed me by, they didn't see me shouting for help.
mapvyoshypych..yvf..fy.
This door is locked, and it looks like its held shut an electronic lock. It'll move a little, but it won't open. It also looks like there were zombies in here.
A device that you can use to lure out the intelligent swamp creature. To activate it, you need to deploy and activate the device in the desired area.

A device that'll protect its user from strong psionic radiation emitted by certain mutants. Its design is based on a brain simulator that's meant to stimulate brain function in zombified civlians or stalkers.
A box of ammo to give to Ferret.
A heavy backpack, presumably filled with artifacts. An orange glow can be seen glowing through the fabric.

An old shabby diary that was found in the cab of a rusty and radioactive diesel locomotive, which, by some unknown coincidence, turned out to be very far from the railroad. The decayed remains of what appeared to be the author of the diary was found in the cabin. Judging from the records, he was trying to hide from the horrors of the Zone by hiding in the cabin.\n"... There are still voices swirling around in my head. They don't want to come out. They ask me to look out the window so they can see what's left. There's nothing there. Nothing. But I silence them, because I'd go crazy if I looked outside. It's empty. No color and no space. And who will survive when they see the void? No one. There's nothing there. There is only the room within me, and I within which is the room. There's nothing on the other side. Nothing at all. Sometimes I hear something creaking or growling on the other side. It's all a voice, a voice out of me. There's nothing out there. I crawl around the room so that God forbid I see the void. My body aches. The head, too. My geiger counter keeps crackling. I threw it into the void so it won't get in the way."
Documentation about the installation at Lake Yantar

These documents were found in an underground complex under Lake Yantar. They talk about starting work on an artificially grown, biological psionic emitter. The very first pages are filled with data that's about the arrival of biological materials: dogs who used to belongs to people who lived at Pripyat, left after evacuation, or the wolves that have multiplied in the Chernobyl forests. However, if some records are to be believed, there were already doubts at that time that they would not be enough for long-term research, so the search for a new source of biomaterials was actively underway. In the appendices is a group photo of the complex workers next to a life support device of a severed head from a dog. Some of the scientists' faces are censored. In the last pages there is a list of the first semi-annual shift of explorers, as well as a complete list of instructions for them, prescribed by the management.

This PDA was found near the MedPribor Institute, laying on the ground next to an abandoned military helicopter. Apparently, the this PDA originally belonged to a pilot. The helicopter surveyed Cordon, the Garbage, Dark Valley and the vicinity of the Research Institute before hitting the anomaly and making an emergency landing. Many large sites in the south of the Zone are noted on the PDA. This data has not fallen into the hands of Perimeter Command and is unlikely to ever fall into the hands of Perimeter Command, so don't worry about the military advancing deeper into the Zone. You can try to transfer the data detailing the important locations noticed and cataloged by the pilot to your PDA yourself - this information will certainly not be superfluous.

The leader of the Freedom faction, nicknamed Chrome, asked me to disable a psionic device that the scientists had abandoned. According to him, the house where the scientists were located is in the southeast. At the same time, a cluster incredibly strong radiation was detected in that area. I'll need to prepare for this mission properly.
A VSS Vintorez that's been modified with a Gravi artifact, improving its ballistic performance. This weapon is an experimental prototype.
The battery is required to start a vehicle's engine, supplying needed electricity to various components.

There is no Monolith. It doesn't exist and never has existed, Gunslinger. And you're the one who told me that when we were on the outskirts of Radar. Obviously, the Monolith is just another psychotropic facility that was built as a last layer of defense. Defense from who and from what, you ask? From stalkers, of course. But who organized the defense is already a mystery. You knew it, but you didn't have time to tell me. What is true about the rumors of wish fulfillment? It's very hard to say. Someone may have gotten to the Sarcophagus and was able to make a wish at the Monolith. But none of these stalkers are alive. It's also very likely that when a stalker makes a wish, a blowout occurs. I don't know if there's any way to get to the bottom of whoever is behind this. After all, that's what we've been trying to do for a long time. As far as I know, you were trying to get to them during the time you became 'thrice-born'. That's what the stalkers call you, right? I don't know what went wrong then. Maybe the Monolith isn't the last line of defense? Maybe, there's another one and we didn't know about it? I believe there is something else that's protecting whoever is behind this. There's something behind the power plant. But where it is exactly is a mystery. There's also something else alluding us: the location housing the device that can deactivate the installation is unknown. In the meantime, I'm gonna try to get in touch with someone I know. I trust him completely to help me figure this out. You, Gunslinger, can try to get into the center of the Zone again. If I hear anything, I'll contact you.

You should know, Gunslinger, how many times I've told you this... I worked in a settlement in the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone before the Second Disaster happened. I worked for a newspaper. I was typing something for someone then, uh.. I can't remember now, what, and to whom exactly - the Zone erased almost all my memories of the Big Land. I remember some yellow press where some of the articles were personally sponsored by the mayor. And then it started, the first warning bells. Something's happened here with the military coming in large numbers. It's just like what's happening right now. I remember four trucks of soldiers were brought into our village. A two-story headquarters was built in two days, can you believe it? And the mayor was pale all day. I went to the checkpoints - there were already barbed wire and mines at the entrances to the city. They refuse to answer any questins, they say they're not supposed to answer. Even to the reporters, they said. And then... From the neighboring village, the children left. All of them. At night, when their parents were asleep. There aren't even any babies left. The next morning, there's an uproar, mothers are throwing themselves at the military checkpoints, demanding to know what happened. They thought they'd taken the kids. The military didn't know what was going on. What I saw left me with many questions, but no answers. So I went to that village, for our newspaper. I talked to the locals and asked around, talked to internal affairs. Neither of them don't remember anyhing. It's like everyone's memory has been erased. Not all of it, selectively. But about the kids, they don't remember anything at all. Some couldn't even remember their names. The cops, of course, they blamed it on the vodka, because the people in that village drank a lot. But I've been talking to some acquaintances from there who are teetotalers... No, there wasn't a mass drinking party. What did I learn from them, you ask? Nothing useful. I had to wait. And I waited. Children are starting to disappear from other townships. Same diagnosis - no one remembers anything and no one saw anything. Some were able to stay in their home village or leave for another city out of fear for their child, and others stayed in their home village, believing that no one could protect their child better. That's what everyone thought before the Second Catastrophe. The buses came, people started evacuating. You can't imagine the panic back then. They thought another reactor had exploded. Some of the old-timers have been around since eighty-six. They're the ones who remembered how the army arrived the day after the accident, and the evacuation was much more announced after a considerable amount of time after accident happened. And in our case, things were even worse: the military took too long and they didn't evacuate people until two months later. My neighbor, when I last saw him.. he was calculating something. I asked people I know how he's been dosed. We didn't know what really went on here in those days. And from my perspective, the thought occurred to me that if the kids went anywhere, it was to the Zone. There's nothing there that doesn't confirm an overlap between the two events. I decided one night, I'd sneak into the Zone. Just for one day, just to check things out. I got there just before the military had their first breakthrough into the Zone. I watched them all die in anomalies from afar. Some of the APCs had been abandoned. The ones on the road to the center are often found there to this day. I went deep into the Zone and that's it. It's like the memories of the Big Land have been cut off by something. Slowly, so that I didn't notice. There's still something left to remember. Most important: my name, nickname, how to eat, drink, and how to handle weapons. I can still communicate with people, thankfully. And I can't remember the title of our newspaper I used to work for. I can't remember what's been going on at Kiev. What is it, events in the capital - I can't remember its name... It's possible, that the Zone is taking away our memories? Selectively, I think. Takes away some, and fixes others so you can't get them out of your head. I remember I used to be a journalist. I remember the village, my neighbor, the kids. And the same phrase keeps running through my head: find the children. I can't get any peace. And I'm not gonna rest until I find it. It's the Zone that's holding me back.

I can't go to the Big Land anyway, The Zone is holding me back, it wants me to be here. And I know a lot about the Zone - I know about the labs that helped to create it, and what's going on closer to the center of the Zone. There's no turning back.

I know that shortly before the first day, all the children left the settlements near the borders of the current Chernobyl Exclusion Zone. They're probably in the center, on the other side of the Winds of Madness installation. In the South, all the places have been explored by stalkers, but in the north, where there aren't so many people, there may be there. Something happened back there at the center that lured kids to the Zone. Just the kids, not adults. And what metamorphosed them here and turned them into dwarfs is a mystery. I'm sure the center of the Zone also has labs, with evidence explaning what has happened.

It's hard to say. On the one hand, what you're describing are tales that only newbie stalkers that take Toad's bullshit seriously believe. On the other hand, we are in the Zone, where anything is possible. Maybe you really are the Chosen One who can change the world.
One of the mobile science teams has gone missing in the Silent Hills area. I should try to find them, and if possible - find out what happened to them.
A professor from the science complex at Lake Yantar asks for two strong gravitational artifacts in order to establish a business relationship with him.
Scientists from a group that specializes in researching magnetic artifacts require two magnetic artifacts for futher study.
Scientists from a group that specializes in researching magnetic artifacts require two magnetic artifacts for futher study, plus an Electric Ball artifact.

The scientists from the group that specialize in magnetic artifacts have given me this artifact, and they want me to throw it into an Electro anomaly. After I do so, they want me to recover it and bring it back so they can study it.
I've been given another order by the scientists that specifically study magnetic artifacts. They want me to get a gauss rifle magazine, preferably one that still has a charge in it.
I've been given a strange order by the scientists that specialize in magnetic artifacts. They want me to bring them.. a Vintorez rifle? I don't understand why they need it, but I'll do it.

These nerds aren't so simple. They're working for the Ukrainian military. Well, army toys for the stalker cause are always useful. I need to fire a few hundred rounds from a prototype Vintorez rifle that's been given anomalous magnetic properties - it has various bits and pieces from an magnetic artifact integrated into it. After I finish testing it, I need to give it back to the scientists.

These are documents that are from the MedPribor Research Institute. It says on the cover that this is the main part of the documents, and somewhere is the application part. Inside, in addition to plans of a storage rooms with hazardous biological materials and a list of the institute's personnel, one can find instructions from the head of scientific work: Due to the fact that some of the test subjects from the Department of Bio-breeding and Eugenics (Head of the Department - L. P. Romaniuk) represent a danger to the staff, the meeting was put together and all involved decided to organize a storage of bio-waste unsuitable for further work. Pre-dead bio-waste that remains after experiments should be transported away from the research areas to the disposal site (Rassocha Technique Cemetery). At the disposal site, the waste should be buried under layers of metal junk and rubble, all of which is in abundance in the Zone. The railroad hangar is to be converted into a bio-waste storage facility for sorting. There is a high probability that these burials near any rivers will cause a marked deterioration of the ecological situation in this region, so water collectors at the railroad facility should be brought to a suitable condition, for water filtration. All subsequent burial and water filtration directives were sent to the railroad facility management. \n Pencil marking - The first part of the control code is "65".

These documents were found at the Garbage. The cover has "Personnel" written on it with black gel pen. In these documents is seemingly endless directives for troubleshooting the water collection system and the list of warehouse personnel, which numbered about a hundred names. There are also records of burials and the reception of bio-waste from research labs: A fresh batch of biological materials from the MedPribor Research Institute has been received and is being transferred to our disposal. For the disposal of the waste, military personnel involved in guarding the warehouses north of the Rostok plant (approximately an hour's drive from the above facility) were engaged. Among other things, we had to ask for five more trucks from the storage garages to transport the waste because the previous vehicles were already contaminated and not suitable for further use, so they will be disposed of at our landfill. For the new machines, everything has already been sorted out, the documents have been signed, and copies of the documentation are in the archive in the main warehouse building. The original documents will be sent to the MedPribor archives next week. \n Pencil marking - The second part of the control code is "76".

These are documents that are from the MedPribor Research Institute. It says on the cover that this is the application part of the documents, and somewhere is the main part. There's almost nothing interesting except that these documents are signed by the technical director of site security after the Second Catastrophe: After the increase of anomalous activity in the region and loss of communication with a number of northern laboratories (Complex ZX-06, Laboratory Center, ZX-10), the management of the Research Institute decided to evacuate the personnel and preserve the Institute. Any attempt to escape from the regime territory will be punishable by death. All instructions have already been issued to the site security to deal with trespassers. They should dispose of all bio-materials of the research on site to avoid leakage. Further transportation of bio-waste to the Rassokha burial ground for further burial follows. Check the Institute's archive for compromising data and destroy it before the troops arrive. After all procedures for the conservation of the facility have been carried out, Institute personnel should break through to the Laboratory Center, regardless of the anomalous activity in its region to stabilize the experiment and eliminate its consequences. \n Pencil marking - The third part of the control code is "82".

These papers were found at Silent Hills, and they seem to be copies. The originals may have been destroyed long ago. Beneath the cover are electroencephalogram readings with notes made in black marker. Next to the results of the graphical record is a trip report to a research facility on one of the islets in Lake Yantar. No irregularities were observed during the demonstration of the operation of the ZX-08 biological unit with a unique (to date) sample of artificially grown biomass (sample Y-1M). The research department took every precaution in activating the facility: the attendees were given level one safety spacesuits and medical supplies with ampoules of psi-blocker drugs (in case if the demonstration got out of hand). The 1269-bis subjects were exposed to surface psionic radiation. Any attempts to impede our control were blocked on a mental level. Fields with multidirectional acceleration vectors (gravity concentrates) were tested on the same subjects. The results of the experiment are recorded on tape. A copy of the tape could not be obtained, so it's currently archived at the research complex. Among other things, recordings of previous experiments and demonstrations are also there. \n Pencil marking - The fourth part of the control code is "27".

These papers were found at Lake Yantar. They're in a thick folder stuffed with scientific documents. These documents are clearly of value to someone who understands the endless stream of mind-numbing numbers, graphs and schematics of the transmitter device on them. Beneath a layer of papers that have partially turned to dust, there is a tape recording of the tests being performed. It's impossible to view it without the necessary equipment. There is also a letter to the head of the central lab that apparently was never sent to the recipient.
"Recently demonstrated to our dear guests was the workings of an artificially grown biological psionic emitter. Everything went well, no comments were received. We are ahead of schedule and have almost overtaken the Kaymanov emitter in terms of power. To do that, truth be told, we had to increase the bio-mass by about a quarter using test biological material, which meant we'd have to go back to Pahlo for everything we needed. Please talk him into another shipment of prisoners from his colony. Subjects for Rainbow are supplied uninterruptedly and on demand, while for our laboratory we have to beg! As if to spite me. I know we're not going to run out of this resource anytime soon, so don't talk about limitations. Speaking of which, I was at their demo recently, in the staff room by the main emitters. The trial information is there, so I suggest you familiarize yourself with it sometime too. Kaymanov just recently had a cooling problem with the rig there. He says it's related to nitrogen tanks leaking. For that matter, ask him what's in there. He'll tell you all about it, ha ha." 
 Pavel Stepanovich Prikhodko, Head of Laboratory ZX-52.
Pencil marking - Fifth part of control code - "18".

These documents were found at Radar. Somebody ripped out the title page, but everything else is in place. Each page is stamped "classified" and signed "D. M. Kaymanov". At the very bottom of the folder is an envelope. The addressee is the same person - Kaymanov. "Dmitri Mikhailovich, how could it be so, eh? After all, you promised that there would be no more escapes of biological material. We supply them to your lab on short notice, and you lose them. We found one at Agroprom not too long ago. Be thankful they still gave it back to you instead of giving it to Prikhodko or giving it back to Pakhlo. By the way, I heard that Prikhodko keeps threatening to file a complaint against you. Why? For failing to follow safety procedures during an demonstration. They say the drugs were not given to everyone, and there were holes in the defense. And this installation of yours is, quote, "no good at all - a total waste of equipment and cooling systems". What's suspicious is that your staff performance reports say the exact opposite. I'll stop by after the Center's installation test - I'll look into it personally. And last but not least, I heard a rumor that you lost your papers again on your trip to Pripyat. For the second time in six months. The first time wasn't enough for you? You'll pick them up personally from the Pripyat school. How and when doesn't interest me." Vadim Mikhailovich Chubko\nPencil marking - The fifth part of the control code is "05".

These documents were found at Pripyat. They should have been covered in a thick layer of dust the whole time they'd been here, but someone had went through them and made notes with a pencil not too long ago. The last entry was a short time ago, "Gunslinger, I'll be in near the Freedom base. Find me in one of the houses on the outskirts of town. I'll be waiting. Glad you're back. Hurry up. Journalist." This entry was on top of an old notebook whose owner had previously used it as a personal diary:\n
"Strange place they chose for the installations. The soil is completely unusable and terribly radioactive. We had to wear NBC suits, which are usually worn by Chernobyl personnel, to avoid grabbing a large dose. Even now, sitting in the break room, I don't want to take the food offered here. It's a good thing no one's gonna bother you here. Vadim Mikhailovich gave a full tour of the central laboratory. He described the working principle of the plant and its objectives. The sheer scale of it is truly mesmerizing, and my emitter is no match for it. I was particularly struck by its surface generators. We were not allowed to get close to them - the background radiation near them is just off the scale. It's scary to think what the future holds for those who are setting up and preparing these generators now, or their descendants. Vadim Mikhailovich demonstrated the operation of the plant. For this purpose, ten laboratory employees, including Vadim Mikhailovich himself, had to be involved. From the observation post we watched what was happening. Vadim Mikhailovich kept bragging that he would catch God by the beard. This time he didn't just grab it, he ripped it out by the root." \n Pencil marking - The fifth part of the control code is "88".
Extract from Kiev branch of laboratory No. 15

To the head of the strict regime 1269 bis Pakhlo K.P.\nKirill Petrovich, again I address you with a request. I'm interested in a sheep from your farm. Index: 115. V. D. Krivoshein. I would like to get his dossier soon, and preferably himself. They are willing to give a little more for this frame than for an individual prisoner, but this time already after receiving a copy. Leave transportation to us again - your men are already getting suspicious at the checkpoint.
Prof. Chubko V. M.
I have no idea where you got the lists of our prisoners, but I have to say in advance that I don't want to know. I can't attach the dossier from the archive - there will be a check the other day, so I'll write here the basic data: Viktor Davidovich Krivoshein, born in 1968. He's the organizer and chief ideologue of the Grey Brothers religious group. The group was engaged in sectarian activities. Occasional cases of robbery that have led to fatal shootouts, and cannibalism have been seen among the sect members. He's been here since 1996, and he's been sentenced to life imprisonment. Krivoshein is undergoing psychotherapy sessions, but the prognosis from our psychologists is disappointing. I'll try to forward this frame to you as soon as possible.
Yours sincerely, Warden of Maximum Security Unit 1269 bis, Palo K.P.
P.S. From myself I will add the following: there is practically no data about Krivoshein's past in the dossier. However, I was able to learn from my sources that before the religious organization came into existence, he worked in some institute that dealt with the problems of self-government. Probably, after the collapse of the USSR, the institute was closed, and the biography of the employees was "cleaned up". Well, I don't need to tell you about that.
P.S. 2. The "higher-ups" are still trying to hush up the story of that march of the "brothers" in the capital so that no one would remember it. I assume you remember this event...

We are very far away from HIS black blinding radiance. His call is heard, but, in truth, His voice isn't as strong in the North, in HIS domain. We're holed up in some basement. We try to go outside as little as possible. The brothers say that in this city one should never go out into the main square because the arrows of the infidels dot the roofs of the city. Someday the mighty fist of the Monolith will reach here as well, bringing us triumphant victory. In the meantime, all we have to do is bring in reinforcements. The second group should be here soon, which will at least increase our presence in this sector a bit. About five minutes ago, Big Brother had warned me that it would soon be necessary to descend into the city's sewers, from where we could strike at the heretics in the Cooptorg building. But before that, we'll have to deal with the man-eating rats that infest the sewer.

A spiral-bound notebook found on the corpse of a stalker in the Garbage. Only the first third of the notebook was has any writing in it, the rest of the sheets were left untouched. Judging by the abrupt ending of the last entry, death caught up with the stalker as he was writing something. The last page says:\nFerret is a liar. You can't trust him, I'll tell the Barkeep that when I get to the bar. He said everything peaceful and quiet at the Garbage, just kilometers of iron and anomalies. Nope, there were bandits there, and they took everything I had. I've got nothing now except the clothes on my back. How am I supposed to go to Agroprom now? I'm gonna kill myself if I don't get the papers. I guess I'll have to go to the bar first to get a gun, and then...

A set of power fist gloves. These gloves use the energy of a strong gravitational artifact to help augment its effectiveness, using its anomalous power to help focus and intensify the force exerted by the fists when it hits something.

A specialized PDA that belonged to a member of the military science team. There's information containing basic details related to various artifacts inside it, as well as encrypted coordinates for specific locations.

The Gravity Glove is a new experimental weapon that deals damage using the forces of gravity. It was developed by scientists who wanted to make a device that weaponizes gravity. This device can attract and repel objects, and it can also work through walls. Its distance limit is 30 meters, and the device's effectiveness depends on how close objects are to it.
Usage: 
1.Abruptly pull an object toward you. 
2.Hit and push an object

A checkered notebook that was found in the glove compartment of a truck. Its previous owner ripped out the first pages for some reason, so it's impossible to find out when exactly he started keeping the diary. Judging by the earliest surviving date, he was involved in transportation of equipment and personnel even before the second disaster. Among the invoices and equipment lists are the coordinates of some laboratories that exchanged information and biological materials among themselves. The last entry was two years ago: Military stalkers have been opening fire on every car since the Death Trucks showed up. This sucks. I picked up some stalker at their base, and got caught when those freaks noticed him. Just my luck. I still can't figure out how I survived that mess. The stalker I was driving around introduced himself as Gunslinger. I thought I'd take him to the scientists' camp, where he'd be back on his feet in no time, but he didn't trust the scientists, as it turned out. He said, "Take me to the doctor."
A regular handheld flashlight. It's highly durable, able to take a good beating. It's also highly energy efficient and does not not require recharging. In a pinch, you can use this as a club.
To complete the experiment, this anomalous artifact must be thrown into an Electro anomaly.
