This artifact is the result of what happens when a certain artifact is introduced to an Electra anomaly. You need to give this to the scientist who asked you for help with his artifact experiment.
An old army knife. The blade itself is worn and pitted, but still sharp.
I think you need a protective device to get through here.
Toad: Don't go there now. This place is dead, the level of psionic activity is off the charts. Consider yourself warned, stalker.
I remembered a code. It's 3781, and it seems to be for some door that's located underground. I think it might be in the tunnels under.. Rostok?

What? We don't do that. Where did you get this information? Although, maybe whoever told you that meant the camp on the marshes. There's a helicopter with equipment there quite often. It's not working right now though, because of the high psionic radiation.

According to the directive of the Central Committee of the CPSU, the territories within the unconditional mandatory resettlement zone (hereinafter referred to as the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone) within a radius of ten kilometers from the site of the accident, as well as a number of infrastructure facilities and dual-use cities (Jupiter plant, Chernobyl-2, Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant named after M.V. Lomonosov, Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant, and the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant), were to be resettled within a radius of ten kilometers from the site of the accident. Lenin, Yantar complex) together with all documentation are transferred under the management of the governmental organization MOST (Ministry of Defense and Secret Technologies). The primary goals of the above facilities has been this since the beginning of 1987: to conduct projects "Sky-2", "Cover", development of means of psychotropic defense and attack, genetic research, experiments in the field of vortex flows and electromagnetic anomalies in various areas of the world and development of new types of energy. A decision was made to conduct the first test launch of the RD-100 special-purpose unit (aka "Russian Woodpecker", Zagorizontnaya Radar Power plant "Duga") under the conditions of increased background radiation in the environment.
A flask. Useful for storing or transportating liquid.

Wow! A local legend, here in my workshop! Oh, well. I'm Amethyst. I repair weapons and equipment. You know it's kind of hard to do that around here, so I got into the Ecologist business. Never enjoyed scrouging through truck cemetaries and waste landfills anyhow. So, do you need anything fixed?
Water sample from the swamp at the Agroprom Research Institute
Water sample from the swamp at the Agroprom Research Institute
Toad wants a water sample from the swamp at the Agroprom Research Institute. He said that there's a suitable liquid container for it somewhere in the factory.

Digger needs an anomaly detector - preferably one that's charged. He said there's one stashed on the roof of the factory somewhere. He also said something about some stalker with an eye patch that hangs around there. Sounds like bullshit to me.
This object is an concentrated version of the Studen anomaly. When it's broken, a new anomaly will form.
Observations on changes in the hierarchy of recessive traits

Vadim Mikhailovich, we continue to conduct tests as normal. We are waiting for you at our farm to admire the results of recent tests. We are already testing breeds with introduced "wild" genes. In the attachments to this letter, you can take a look at photos of some of the specimens: you can already clearly see the changes in the musculoskeletal system and the physiology of the sensory system. I also recommend looking at the results of experiments to transplant the pituitary gland of the African "hyena" into our wolves. Amazing, isn't it? By the way, yesterday - I. G. Uralov suggested that we should already proceed to transplantation of human pituitary gland, but I had to give up this venture. I'm sorry, I don't have a qualified Preobrazhensky here yet. Our experienced staff are on a different level of our sixth lab. And the human pituitary gland, Vadim Mikhailovich, is no joke! However, I refused to refuse, but I will not say that this idea will be forgotten for a long time. In the future, we plan to move on to much more serious experiments. It's very unfortunate that the unit you have allocated does not allow for a full range of long term concentrated gravity treatments. It just doesn't have enough power. Get it right: other departments get 20% more energy. Even Makarov's department consumes more, even though he has only three lab technicians on staff and they only do accounting. If you would be so kind, Vadim Mikhailovich, increase the lab's power allocation. Tell your people at the plant to get the new fourth reactor up and running within a month. Believe me, it will speed up the work process. Head of the Department of Biological Breeding and Eugenics, L. P. Romaniuk 15.04.1986
The conversion requires: Strong gravitational artifact and Strong Needles.

Listen, we got a case for you. Have you heard of the Monolithians? They're local fanatics. They believe a crystal or monolithic block from space fell on the roof of the power plant. Guys say that no one can come closer than 30 meters to them, or they immediately start shooting.

Anyways, our snipers started spotting them on the road to the Swamps. This is no good, I can feel it. I suspect they've got a staging area somewhere up there by the road to the Swamps. You should go see what's out there.. but, you know, we're not really in conflict, we don't touch each other, but they're still fucking unpredictable. There's no guarantee they won't attack us tomorrow. See if you can find where they've settled. The snipers that are observing them told me that they're mostly active at night, so I think after midnight you'll have a chance of catching up with them.

You saved my hide again. This is the second time you've done so? I've lost count, frankly. Okay, now for the main point. I'm never coming back to this house again. Information has surfaced that the military has secured exits to this city, which means that now I will definitely not be left alone after our joint "business" in the Valley. Rumor has it that some merchants are doing business with the army, which means it's not safe for me to be in the city. We'll have to leave the shelter and move north. I'd advise you to move somewhere away from the suburbs, too. But knowing you and your appetite for trouble, I realize that you'll ignore my advice. Those documents we got in the Valley give some insight into the situation around the international research center in the Zone. Until recently, this center did exist, but what has become of it now is unknown. Perhaps it still exists today. We need to find it, Gunslinger. Unfortunately, I don't have any more information about this center. The eggheads from Yantar couldn't say anything - they blamed it all on signatures on non-disclosure and release of state secrets. By the way, if you get a chance, I suggest you drop in on an old acquaintance in the Swamps. He asked me to tell you that he got the medicine you asked for from the scientists. Be careful out there. Stalkers in the bar say that after the extreme emission there, the psionic radiation levels there have become dangerous. Take the other trail. Take care of yourself, for the Zone's sake.\n\nJournalist

Personnel: 1,245.
Combatant composition: 763 are official military personnel; 16 are military stalker guides.
Support: 45 Armored Personnel Carriers (BTR-70), 8 T-64 tanks, 3 Mi-24 helicopters.
Main route: equipment graveyard - City - Old Storages - Pripyat - Power plant - F12L area.
Reserve: equipment cemetery - City - Lake Yantar - G. Free Way - Pripyat - Power plant - F12L area.
Digression: not provided.
Additional information: There may be previously unknown anomalies closer to the F12L area. Resistance: unknown. The discovery of the remains of the first exploring expedition is likely.
Objective: to break through to the epicenter of the Zone and destroy the cause of the deadly anomalous fields. Stop the growth and expansion of the Zone's anomalous fields. Locate those involved in the creation of the Zone.
2009.05.13.
Part of the plans and maps of one of the lost detachments of the military expedition

The state commission found no violations during its inspection of the science facilities. The Commission concluded to issue a permit for extension of research works on the territory of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone no later than 02.06.1998. Currently, the Agroprom scientific research institute Agroprom (see Annex ** for a breakdown of activities) is developing equipment for complex devices used in radiation oncology. From the technical data, it appears that the device will be in high demand for patients with "tumor cordis, casus inoperabilis". The main advantages of the new equipment: increased safety measures for both the patient and the treating physician during the procedure, and the record speed of its irradiation procedure. In this regard, we ask to withdraw the research documents from the Central Archive and transfer them to the file cabinet of the Agroprom Research Institute to optimize the reporting work.

... The first reports of missing children from the village, which is close to the perimeter of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone, were received by the Ivankivka District Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs only the next morning. Neither the distribution of orientations nor the help of volunteers yielded promising results. It was decided by the rescue team coordinators to triple the radius of the search area. "In case the missing children are not found within three weeks, the search will have to be called off," the leader of a group of volunteers in Sector A8 warns us.\n\nLaw enforcement officials have suggested that children may have traveled to the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone, but military cordon commanders say that no persons under the age of majority have been recorded in the vicinity of the thirty-kilometer perimeter. In response to the lead coordinator's request for permission to search for the children on the territory of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone, the perimeter commander refused, citing the territory's closed military regime. Photos, first and last names can be seen on the last page. The editorial board of the newspaper "Echo of Chernobyl" according to the rescue group is offering a cash reward for any information on the whereabouts of the missing children that will help the search.

You've been to the factory before, right? They say it's notorious among stalkers, and that anyone who climbs into the attic will have bad luck. At the Garbage, a guy with an eyepatch even said that a legendary stalker once got betrayed and died there.

Yeah, well.. yeah. In the grand scheme of things, it's up to you, but I need a simple anomaly detector. I heard there's one hidden in the attic of the factory.. unless, of course, it's already been stolen. If you get it, I'll give you a new 9x18 pistol. It's up to you, kid, if you want to do this or not.
The door! Close the door, this isn't a passageway.
What are you, drunk? Get down from there!

To the Head of Kiev Branch of Laboratory No. 15, Karteevich I. L.
 Ivan Lvovich, after conferring with the rest of the group, we have unanimously approved an offer to give you a sample of the anomalous body, as you requested. The body itself is dangerously close to the infamous Helena cap, due to the difficulty of studying it on site. What we've been able to discover about the nature of the crystal is described below. We send you a sample container. The container has a label that says: "Monolith 2."
*** 
 The crystal was found in the bowels of Unit 4 - it's a body of anomalous nature that has no analogs with officially (and unofficially) known to modern science alloys. The pisonic radiation levels it emits range from ~1200 to ~1500 Gigawatts, which is incredibly dangerous for the life of anyone who comes within ten meters of it. In addition to that, we discovered a peculiarity in the behavior of the crystal: the creation of organic and of inorganic substances from literally nothing.

In this personal diary that belonged to a stalker who did hunting, you've found very interesting notes detailing the habits of bloodsuckers:

Entry 1: From the description of the intense raid into the Silent Hills: Followed Bull's group from afar. The big man and the rookies entered the village. Knowledgeable people avoid this place, knowing that its inhabitants are dangerous. Very carefully, trying not to make a sound, the stalkers walked around the crumbling wall of the water tower. They came to a low spot between two hills. There they noticed bodies lying around. They carefully moved closer. In front of them was a gruesome sight: disfigured corpses that belonged to two stalkers. The impression of the bodies was as if not only blood, but all the insides had been drained out of them, leaving only the skin, the outer shell. The stunned stalkers staggered back to cover. Meanwhile, from behind, a tall mutant with huge outgrowths on its muzzle silently jumped down from the five-meter wall. His sickle-shaped arms opened to embrace Bull, who stood closer to him. The thug's back felt someone's presence. He abruptly recoiled and turned around at the same time. Too late - sickle-shaped hands with long fingers and strange suction cups on their palms grabbed his abruptly collapsed body. Fainting, the stalker notices a terrifying face, with ugly outgrowths instead of a mouth, approaching his neck. The rookies managed to run away with ghastly screams, leaving their mentor to die. They didn't get far - the frightened stalkers ran straight into the anomaly field.

Entry 2: Bloodsucker. High humidity and darkness create all the conditions necessary to live and hunt. Skin-eating mucus retains its main properties only in a moist environment. Since the bloodsucker has a thermoregulation system that's comparable to the primitive one a frog has, its metabolism is slow, depending on the air temperature. The best climate for a bloodsucker is high humidity and temperatures above 17-18 degrees Celsius. The bloodsucker is a nocturnal animal, the retina of its eye has more cones than the retina of a human being, allowing it to see in the dark and twilight better than in the daytime. In the dark, the bloodsucker's pupils are understandably dilated, so in the light of a flashlight a retina is visible: the so-called red-eye effect.
 Record 3: Possible habitat identified:
 Dungeons:
1. Caves 2. Underground corridors 3. Basement Surface:
1. Wastelands 2. Dumps Premises:
1. Factory premises 2. House premises 3. waste storage facilities 4. Paddocks Anomalous zones:
1. Radiation hotspots 2. Fog
Entry 4: An interesting subject for zoologists are the tentacles around its mouth. Presumably these are modified parts of a mouth - tongue, cheeks and mandible. The bloodsucker's mouth cavity disappeared, splitting into tentacle-like branches. They serve several functions. Basically, it is a sensory organ and part of the oral apparatus. As a sensory organ, the tentacles are analogous to the bifurcated tongue in reptiles. Their surface is heterogeneous and on the inner (mouth) part is dotted with many receptors - this is one of the most sensitive areas in the bloodsucker. A bloodsucker's mucous glands are located in the inner surface of their tentacles. The internal structure of the tentacles corresponds to their functional purpose, i.e. it's permeated with blood vessels and nerves. It also has three layers of musculature, allowing the bloodsucker to utilize them as it feeds. When in a relaxed state, the tentacles sway and pick up odors in the air.

An old yellowed notebook with notes that sheds some light on the first military expeditions to the Zone. Most of the pages are bloodstained or missing altogether. In some places, the handwriting is impossible to make out.
 Record 3. 15.03.2007
 ... The evacuation of civilians from the village took longer than the military cordon leadership had originally anticipated. We're missing five residents. They're all in their mid-twenties. According to eyewitness accounts, an hour after the "incident" the old men took off northward. The major strictly forbade to send any group after them...
 Record 5. 16.03.2007
 ... We came to a graveyard of radioactive equipment. Lost two boxes along the way. The first one somehow ducked into the curb and all the electronics failed. The second one suddenly stopped in the middle of the road at the entrance to the dump. There are rumors among officers that the enemy is using electromagnetic weapons and disabling our equipment to delay us. The question is: who is the enemy?
 Record 11. 19.03.2007
 ... The major has gone completely off the rails - he suggests that we fortify ourselves in the city and wait there for reinforcements. Communication with the command is impossible - the radio is dead. Vasiliev had been working on it for two hours already; the major gave him a hard slap for his careless attitude to the radio. The scouts went north to the old warehouses. They say there may be survivors.
 Record 17. 21.03.2007
 ... We finally found Vasiliev. Locked himself inside in one of the houses on the second floor. Had to break down the door to get to him. He hung himself. The scouts still haven't returned - the Major is already going to send more men after them. Vasyan offered to volunteer. Says we need to make a detour and go out to the Perimeter. I agreed.
This object is an unknown anomalous artifact. It floats a bit in the air, and it also feels quite heavy.
SOS: Come in! Somebody help me, I'm out here in the woods behind the swamp!
Professor: Expect no audience with me, stalker. All questions must be directed to our assistant in the annex next to the bunker.

Hoplite, a stalker, a newcomer to the Cordon, got into trouble. He seems to have been here for a while and may be able to share some information. In order to bring him to his senses, I should give him 2 black thorn artifacts or 5 regular thorn artifacts. I think that should be enough.
Turn on the second floor lights
Turn on the first floor lights
Shit. It's clearly not worth sticking around here for long... and where are all these scientists?
A removeable battery for PDAs that can be recharged. You can use it to increase your PDAs power charge, and to find out what the current charge of your PDA is.
A heavy crate of equipment that's meant for the scientists' camp at Lake Yantar.

It's a saffiano-covered file, obviously owned by a high-ranking person. Inside is a shipment of special equipment to the XZ-09 lab. Probably worth a lot of money. Reports on the observation of the results of experiments.

1) Implementation of the installation of psycho-emotional correction in the settlement of employees of the Atomic Station were successful. An increase in productivity, efficiency and stamina was noticed among the employees of the Chernobyl Station. Psychotherapists note a decrease in emotional tension. However, the contingent complains of a sharp decrease in general commutative manifestations. The version with the consequences of exposure to ionizing radiation is considered official.
 2) Report on observation of the contingent living for a long time in the territories with radiation background, which does not always coincide with the established norms. Unscheduled gene mutations were observed among the subjects. Suddenly, previously recessive traits became dominant, which affected production rates. The observation of the new daughter samples was decided to be handed over to the reserve group. Surveillance of the maternal accessions is continuing.
Stalker, if you come near us, we will open fire. Go away.

The scientist at the science complex at Yantar refuses to let me into the Professor's bunker because of some personal problem. His wife disappeared in a lab under the Dark Valley. He clearly he wants the pendant that he said he gave her? Do I go looking for that pendant, or do I send that asshole back there?
Toad: I lost contact with one of my couriers near an abandoned village. I don't know where he disappeared to. Do me a favor and find him.

Yeah, what did you think? We've got explosives, I think. We've been mining the area. But I can see you got an interest in this place. Here's the deal. You get me an artifact called a Disintegrator, preferably a whole one. And some Zuda. I hear it's good for your health. If you bring me the goods, I'll assign you our bomb squad, he'll do everything... And if you're short on artifacts, fine, I'll take 10,000 from you and you're on your way.
The leader of the Freedom faction asks for a Disintegrator and Zuda artifact or a payment of 10,000 for blowing up the door where the Psi Weapon scientist lived.
An empty jar that's made out of special, highly resistant and durable glass. You can store the substance the Studen anomaly is made out of in it.
On my way to the bar, Witcher sent me a message, asking to meet with me.
A scientist at the Bar asked me to find any information about his missing brother, who worked at the Rostok factory. He promised to give me a suit if I find anything about his brother.
Spread out! It's about to start! According to the intel, the Blind Dogs' lair was supposed to be in that hollow over there- Stalker! Get over here, we need your help!

An experimental sample of an anti-radiation drug that's designed to protect the human body from various types of radioactive contamination. Its effectiveness - and how long it works - usually no more than a few minutes at best, depends on the drug's expiration date.\nServes as a treatment for radiation sickness.
This specific artifact, known as the 'Pee Wee', is a very strange one. It sticks itself to the wall of your backpack, and gives off a faint greenish glow.

Not much, believe me. It's a rare device. Not every soldier in the Zone is willing to share it. Alright, it's self-contained, and its battery charge is gonna last long enough. If you need another one, just don't forget the money.

I decided to raid the Agroprom Research Institute with our local attraction from the death truck... and why not? He even got me a gravity gun to go with it. It's good stuff. I don't forget where I left my backup science outfit from the last raid. I hid it in the cab of the locomotive, I think I'll remember it when I see it. The main thing is that nobody steals it by the time I get there.
Toad: I don't recommend going there, it's a scary place. It's so loud, it's really loud. Although sometimes bandits come from there - local bandits that tend to hang out near the bridge.
Toad said a stalker from the death truck came by looking for me. I should find him in the swamp, he's obviously in one of the huts. Maybe he remembers something and can shed some light on things.
You have to remember to keep your PDA charged, especially during raids.

A Duty stalker in the bar offers to exchange ammunition, and other things, such as gasoline for vodka. At night he can be found at their base, or in its general vicinity - if he's there, he'll agree to barter. However, it is not clear how it may end up.
A regular Dream brand cigarette. Smoking is bad for you, but it'll help take the edge off and calm you down.

I need a weak gravity-based artifact... and a medium one, or a regular one too. Maybe you've seen one of these before. If you bring it in, I'll take it at a higher price. And if you get both of them, I'll give you a little extra for yourself.
A detector that's meant for measuring anomalous activity. In order to make measurements with it, you need to use it with your hands and activate it near a source of anomalous energy.
A plastic bottle filled with cool and refreshing drinking water, great for quenching thirst. These are normally imported into the Zone by traders who buy them in bulk.

I'm going to tell you a story I tell everyone. It's a legend about the Monolith, quite possibly the cause of the Zone. In 2006, the Zone exploded, measures were taken and the population in the area was evacuated, the Zone was cordoned off by army units. No one knew what was going on, panic all around, the Zone was growing, field labs were powerless. A lot of people died inside. Everyone is afraid of radiation that could cover half of Europe.

A few years went by, the first desperate guys like you showed up. They called themselves stalkers. They penetrated through the army cordons, believing that there was something in the Zone, and that this something could bring them riches, fulfill their desires. Slowly they began to bring back strange things from there, artifacts, for which there was an instant race. Scientists went crazy about these things. They paid a lot of money for one of these specimens, not like now. So, the first stories and legends about what was inside the Zone, near the dilapidated nuclear power plant, appeared. One of the veterans recounted a story heard from one of the local stalker old-timers, a story about the Monolith, supposedly fulfilling wishes. What hysteria began here, stalkers gathered in groups and rushed to the center of the Zone, everyone wanted something from the Monolith. There were grim details about the first stalker to reach the Monolith. Back when the Zone first appeared, many people were trapped by it, cut off from the outside world.

Most of them died, but there were rare lucky ones who not only survived, but tried to do something about it. One of the survivors was near the station, he saw a strange glow inside. He had no choice, the way back was cut off, so he got closer. He saw something that stood out to him - the pierced roof of a sarcophagus, illuminated from within. He climbed the wall and the insides of the Sarcophagus were revealed to him. There, among the piles of metal debris and charred concrete, rested a huge black block. It was the Monolith. Then the stalker snapped out of his trance and realized that he had climbed into the Sarcophagus - the Monolith managed to somehow control him from a mile away. Terror gripped him, and through the fear, the Monolith's call was monotonous. The Monolith was calling him, and the stalker's hair stood on end. Strange, eerie images of the alien exploded in his mind. We don't know what's true or false in this story.

The point is that he made a wish, and it came true, and the Zone sharply increased by five kilometers. It seems that for every wish granted, the Zone eats our Earth. But that doesn't stop the stalkers. They continue to rush inside, carrying to the Monolith their innermost desires....

There's a lot of rumors about this thing, about the Monolith. Rumors of all sorts. Some stalker told me that the Monolith is something like-- What did he say? The basis of all human aspirations and desires? Something unique that a person strives for... Quin-tez-sen-tsi-ya, my ass. He said a lot of clever things, I can't remember them all. But I didn't really listen to him. He was a regular motor-mouth - everytime he visited me, I'd wish that he would shut the fuck up and get out of my basement. Though, he was right about something. Everyone wants to go to the Monolith. Rumor has it it's something extraterrestrial. I heard it landed next to the Sarcophagus, or it punched through the roof of the Sarcophagus and into the fourth reactor, yeah. That's why a lot of people think it caused the Zone.

Everything happened suddenly My partner died right before my eyes in fraction of a second, he literally burned out from the inside... what was that? And this call.. something was calling me.. I'll need to tell Toad about this when I'm at his bunker.

A small pile of papers with some drawings and calculations. There's a few things of note in these papers: - "the impact zone of the unit in the city area is approximately several dozen kilometers, depending on the power delivered..." - "mobile versions of units 2 and 3 are currently inactive, unit 3 is still in the science camp as far as I know."

Heard a broadcast on an ancient radio. It's most likely from the Big Land that the other stalkers sometimes mention. I don't know if the broadcast was true or false; an old recording or a live broadcast, but I can't believe what I heard. 

...no real cause for serious concern. 

...temporary measures... 

...drastic changes...

 ... 

...decisive steps... 

...radical changes... 

...it's certainly too early to talk about achieving the biological minimum... 

It feels like the Big Land is in the same mess as the Zone, if not worse. You can't help but wonder if Big Land really exists. I've probably been there, in my past. But what if it doesn't? Maybe there is no Big Land. Then where do the stalkers come from, and where does this broadcast come from?
Refuel the generator (a can of gasoline is required)
Toad: Stalker! You're near the passage to Yantar now. Don't go there now if you don't want your brains to fry.
Bartender: Stalker! You're near the passage to the Quiet Hills. Don't go there now, unless you want your brains to fry. Keep this in mind.
Bartender: Stalker! You are now near the passage to Yantar. Don't even think about going there now if you don't want your brains to get fried.

We are scientists, we are interested in everything that happens here.. So, as I already said, the mutant we're looking for is quite rare in these parts, but recently a group of Freedom members located in the dead city of Light Beam noticed the mutant we're looking for wandering in the general vicinity of the ruined high-rise buildings. This specific mutant is of particular interest to us. The Freedomers have may have noticed the mutant however, and we need the mutant to be safe - they might injure it, so please make sure it's alive and unharmed. You see, our group is small, and we need to collect material, so you must catch this mutant for us. We need living tissue samples, so we can't kill the monster. Try to lock him up somewhere in one of the city's apartments, or in any other suitable place. That's it - please don't botch this job if you take it.
That's it, and now I need a drink. Come back later.

This PDA belongs to a stalker who was part of "Final Day" faction. The last entry is in it reads: "?... the world is heading towards the end of the world... soon the territory of the Zone will increase many times over. There will be several countries in the Zone whose populations will not have time to evacuate... ?data error?... we are tracking down zombified stalkers, studying psionic- radiation, developing theories about psychotropic weapons and how they work. It is necessary to send ?agents?, since the target is extremely difficult to access, even despite the possibility of their penetration beyond the territory outside the Zone."

I caught rabies from a dog bite. I was lucky that I had the opportunity to recover. From now on I'll need to be more careful with dogs; it turns out that these creatures are not as harmless as you might think at first glance. I bet that most of them are infected with rabies - and it's insidious. Symptoms appear spontaneously and not immediately.
Stalker, come into the house. I need help.
Don't shoot. I won't harm you.. unless if you want that, of course.
What the... you're not human. How can you talk?
There was a time when... to say... it's not a problem... stalker, do you happen to have anything to eat?
This stalker suit is completely ruined. It'll keep you warm, but it'll provide almost zero protection against anything else.

I found a man that'll go with me to Agroprom. I need to get a decent suit for him though, otherwise he won't go. Toad said he had one, but in return for it - he asked me to deal with a certain mutant in the village beyond the bridge. I hope this is worth the effort.

Toad promised a new scientific suit for me if I do him a favor. It'll be suitable for trips to research institutes and areas heavily contaminated with radiation. I need to check the railroad embankment, next to which there is a derailed train.
The radioactive house behind the bridge

I got my protective suit, and Toad wanted to take advantage of that fact right away. He asked me to get something that's very dangerous from the house that's producing a lot of radiation like a reactor. The suit I got is supposed to protect against radiation, but I have to check its condition first. If there's a lot of wear and tear, I shouldn't go in there.

I found a strange case at the tower. There were corpses near it - nothing but bones. I think I ran into the the remains of some scientific expedition or something. Toad showed interest, but I decided to keep the case... for now. He told me to talk to a certain Snitch at the Bar, I think I'll share my discovery with him.
I met a stalker named Phil at the Garbage. He asked me to get him his false eye. He says that it's with a stalker at the Duty checkpoint that's at the northern part of the Garbage.

A strange newcomer that's near cliff asked to help him take back his AK-74 that was stolen from him by a bunch of bandits. Not a bad weapon. I could get it and return it to its owner - or keep it for myself.

A device that protects its wearer from the effects of psionic radiation. It'll protect you against low to moderate levels of psionic radiation, but it's useless against high levels of psionic radiation. These are normally used by military stalkers and veteran stalkers.
A barrel that was found in the radioactive house. The inscription on its side reads: "Hazardous materials".

This device discharges anomalies. When it interacts with an anomaly, it temporarily neutralizes its anomalous activity and radiation within a radius of approximately 10 meters around the device. To use it, you need to activate the device next to the anomaly.

A stun gun, presumably developed in the northern part of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone.\nAIt affects people and mutants by causing a feeling of intense panic, causing any would-be attacker to flee or stumble.

I don't know.. they wanted to turn off the radiation on the lower levels in order to gain access to some documents. I don't know the details of all this. Listen, in the main hall there, there should be an emergency switch for opening the front door. This is our chance.. what the?

Closed? Holy shit. We were brought up on a standard nighttime alert. A few minutes to pack, then into the chopper. We got here last night. We had a couple of people with us in, you know - a bunch of eggheads in orange jumpsuits... they were with the equipment, but they're probably rotting around here somewhere. I don't know what it was. It came out of nowhere. We thought it was one of the surviving scientists, but this thing attacked the lieutenant... chewed off half his face. Damn it, get me out of here!
Alright, alright, just tell me how. As soon as I entered here, the door automatically closed. What was the mission of your squad and why did everyone die?

Stalker! Ah, phew.. I thought I was going to stay here forever. Our squad had a mission here.. everyone died. I ran away alone, hid, piled boxes here, fought back for the first time... damn, how long have I been here? I've been here for a day or two. Get me out of here, damn it, please.. I can't do it alone.
Unknown stalker: Damn, this anomaly.. Help me get out of here, please.
Unknown stalker: Hey, you're a stalker! I'm at the tunnel! I'm inside here, please help me!

Messer, you're in the swamp area, aren't you? Got a little errand for you. The scientists at the science camp at Yantar ordered me to get water samples from there. If you're around, do them a favor. There's probably some vials in the abandoned labs somewhere, so you can use those to collect the water samples. Be careful when you go to Yantar, there's so much psionic radiation, you'll burn your brains out if you're careless. Anyway, get some samples, and then when you're near my bunker, drop them off. That's it.
This PDA belonged to a stalker that was part of the Black Slugs group. Merchants offer a good price for it.
This PDA belonged to the leader of the Black Slugs group. Inside it is an entry about the access code to the underground complex - the code being 4578.
I'd rather keep things quiet for now. Come back in the morning.
Hello stalker, what do you need?

Stalkers returning from the Zone sell the artifacts they find to an old trader who used to be a stalker: Toad. He has many connections to the outside world. The customers of artifacts are diverse - scientists, defense contractors, and representatives of corporations. Customers order Toad to collect certain artifacts, and he in turn gives tasks to stalkers. You can also buy weapons and a variety of equipment from him. He ives in the cellar of an abandoned cabin. He's a bossy fat guy with bulging eyes, and he tends to have a very nasty and mean character. He's also dressed in a tank top and pants, and the stump of his left arm is wrapped in black leather. He has difficulty walking because of his broken legs. There are rumors of rookie stalkers that were killed by him, whom he let go on a deliberately deadly mission. But he's the only merchant in the area, so you have to deal with him. He doesn't trust most stalkers with anything, and is frankly rude to most of them. He keeps a shotgun on him just in case, and his mood is as bad as ever.
Great, head to the bunker site.

An old shabby briefcase with a combination lock that's closed. It looks like it won't be possible to open it with improvised means, judging by how secure it is. It's safe to assume that there's something important inside this briefcase.

Hello! We've got a little problem with an expedition that went missing in the Silent Hills. Their signal was lost in the area around the base there. Could you check that place out and see if anything happened to them?
For this specific transmutation you need: Strong Needles and Double Dummy artifacts.
For this specific transmutation you need: Knot and Burning Cotton artifacts.
For this specific transmutation you need: Radioactive Bolt and Rusty Hair artifacts.
For this specific transmutation you need: Toad's Eye and Transparent Ball artifacts.
For this specific transmutation you need: Bagel and Zuda artifacts.
I have a transmuter for artifacts, I'm interested in recipes for it.
Okay, I can sell you recipes for transmutation. Each one will you cost you 1000 roubles. I'll upload the ones you've bought to your PDA.
For this specific transmutation you need: Weak Gravitational and Gravitational artifacts.

This is an experimental artifact crossbreeding device. Developer by scientists at the Lake Yantar laboratory, this device allows the creation of various artifacts - provided that you have the needed recipe for the artifact that you want to create.
A canister filled with gasoline, meant for refueling cars and trucks. It holds a total amount of 15 liters.
Hostage scientist: Someone has come! Is it finally over? Hey, stalker! Are you from the Professor?!

Clear Sky Leader's Note: "The Zone surged and spread in all directions, increasing the size of the affected land at breakneck speed, and the cities caught in the waves of the Emission were dying out, while the territory of the Zone kept growing, expanding in all directions. Across the Earth, people look in horror at the blackened sky, and footage from orbit shows a monstrous black blot that is expanding to swallow up the Earth. When things quieted down, more than 100 square kilometers became desolate. The ground, vegetation, and buildings were covered in black dust. Tons of radioactive dust rose into the air, which was blown by gale-force winds over vast areas, contaminating clean bodies of water and fertile land."
A silver pendant. The Elder gave it to me as a reward for my help.

Diary of a legendary stalker nicknamed Gunslinger. Judging by the worn appearance of the diary, and the fact that there's many entries in it, the owner of this diary has been keeping it for a long time. There are records of attempts to break through to the center of the Zone, some schemes, maps, notes. One journal entry documents a trip to the center of the Zone:

Record #1
"So, the road is scouted, the plan has been made, supplies have been collected, and all of my guns have been cleaned. Thanks to the Doctor, he helped us with medicine and provisions, as we've had a bad time with that lately. I hope it's not all for nothing and we find a clue to what's going on down there. They say that man is wired to be curious and fearful of everything he doesn't know at the same time. But I sense something else, a third thing, something, like a-- a call. 
The important thing is not to forget the main code, 667. That's the most important thing."
A container filled with medical supplies that's meant for the Doctor. It's quite heavy.

This is the Professor from Lake Yantar speaking. In case you haven't heard, there are intense concentrations of psionic radiation at the edge of the swamp. Our workers were doing tests there they just.. disappeared - I don't know what happened to them. The door of the house where the switch is located is coded as we know, and the code is in the possession of another group that was working near the swamp; they left the area due to the Phantasm's strong psionic influence. Maybe they'll come back and one of them will tell you the code.
Message - Sin Leader: Hmm, there he is.. He didn't get far. Finish him, stalker. He's already dead!
SOS: Somebody help! I'm in the house at the swamp!
What do you want?! Get out of here!

Heads of Administration of Rostok plant, Nikolaev O.D. Order I.I. Zyablikov, an employee of the Product Delivery Department, is transferred from the Product Delivery Department to the Research Laboratory No. 6 due to production needs. Date: 10.02.2005 Signed: Nikolaev O.D.
Looks like the plant's human resources department, or some kind of archive.
The Zarya-2 is a flashbang grenade, using blinding light and overwhelming noise to disorientate enemies. These are normally used in hostage rescue or crowd control operations.
A bunch of regular of 5x25mm bolts. These are normally bought fromm hardware stores and used for various DIY repair projects, but in the Zone - these are used by the Gravity Shotgun as ammo.

An anomalous weapon that harnesses the energy of gravitational artifacts, pieced together from various pieces of scrap metal. This weapon uses bolts for ammo, and the high velocity this weapon propels them at makes them incredibly lethal.
 
 Ammunition:
 5x25mm bolts.

Secret To the head of the Psi-Barrier project, Prof. Chubko V.M. From the head of the laboratory K.T.S., Prikhodko P.S. "Test unit ZX-16's report on prohibitive modes." The tests were conducted under conditions of forced underestimation by a factor of 2 of the emergency shutdown barrier due to thermal overheating. The ZX-16 unit was activated in its normal psionic-field mode, Perimeter Defense. The tests performed showed the appearance of uncontrollable peak-like bursts of psionic radiation and induced fields after 5-6 minutes of continuous operation. The strength of the psionic-field reached values of 50 to 60 percent higher than the design parameters of the installation. In absolute values, the values are 170-190 psiA. The obtained values are not explained by Kasyanov's theory of induced psionic-fields, since the result of psionic-field lowering at the moment of transmitter overheating was assumed. Part of the staff believes that the increase in the temperature of the transmitter due to overheating leads to an increase in the parameters of neural activity of the biomass of the "Ya-1M" pseudo-brain and the brain becomes a kind of a repeater of psionic radiation, not only a source of psionic waves pumping the transmitter. But this claim requires a serious experimental test, for which the team lacks the resources to do. Others claim that after the experiments - they go crazy and don't think much at all. This is indeed a problem - some of the staff will have to be parted with soon. Biomaterials exposed to psi-fields during the experiment unfortunately became unusable due to irreversible changes in the activity of the brain and central nervous system. CT scan and encephalogram data are attached in a separate report. In spite of unexpected and unpredictable results of the experiment on the ZX-16 installation, the results are intriguing, because they give the right to assert that the use of psionic emitter together with "Ya-1M" pseudo-brain can give, in the end, a more reliable result of the "Psionic-barrier" system than similar results of our competitors from the laboratory. 12.12.2007 Prikhodko P.S. P.S. To continue the research we need a new batch of biomaterials, in the amount of: 10 animal specimens and 10 human specimens from 1296-bis. Please also send additional guards, as it is becoming problematic to hold the prisoners after they've been exposed to psionic radiation. After the last experiment, some of them managed to escape. During the pursuit, the guards managed to eliminate some of them. The rest were driven into a high radiation area and the pursuit was terminated.
To the head of the laboratory, Prikhodko P.S. Pavel Stepanovich, in my opinion, after the experiments, I've noticed that not only some of the employees, but also YOU are starting to lose your mind - you're a fucking moron using our equipment carelessly. Who gave permission to run the brain-emitter complex under uncalculated conditions? Didn't your grandfather work at Chernobyl Unit 4 in 1986? If the staff during the diaster of 1986 fell under the influence of the "Russian Woodpecker" (there is at least some explanation for stupid experiments there), can you imagine how things would go? The disaster would have been far worse. I can find no explanation for your behavior! The manual says, clear as day, that "it is strictly forbidden to increase the psionic power above 120 psiA." Did you forget about this? Damn it! As a result, you lost control of the biomaterial, and moreover - let it escape. Do you realize how hard it is for me to get prisoners for my experiments? Do you realize the danger if ANYONE gets wind of our experiments? I hope you understand. So please, in the future, don't do anything like this without notifying me personally. I understand a young scientist's desire to outrun his competitors, but keep your head up. Speaking of competitors, the lab at their facility yesterday got the psionic emitters running steadily with only TWO cooling shutdowns per day. 8-30 to 9-45 in the morning and 20-12 to 21-00 in the evening. Therefore, the comparison with your mode (5 min. work -3 min. rest) is clearly not in favor of the installation of your laboratory. The Psionic Barrier should work reliably and without any time irregularities during the cooling period. However, I don't want to upset you, I also think that the complex "pseudo-brain - psionic emitter" is more progressive, intelligent, and the future is behind it. But.. a protective barrier is needed now, so at first it is most likely to use the fully man-made version of your colleagues. Yeah, it works like a sledgehammer - bang and no brains. But, as they say, "without noise and dust", cheap and surly. (just kidding). Please pass on my congratulations to the lab staff on a Happy New Year and Merry Christmas. Prof. Chubko V.M. 20.12.2007 P.S. I will make arrangements for the supply of biomaterials shortly.

Laboratory Order. In connection with the catastrophic disaster that began on April 12 of this year in the center of the Exclusion Zone around the Chernobyl NPP, I've issued numerous directives. Directive 1: Laboratory staff must copy lab reports and assemble 4 sets of documents, along with destroying the original classified documents. Directive 2: Security must dispose of all biomaterials. Directive 3: Perform preservation of the laboratory. Directive 4: Prepare to load the experimental program "Shroud of Darkness" into the "Ya-1M" pseudo-brain, as well as the activation of all external tracking sensors. Directive 5: Activate wind turbines and backup power sources, switch the laboratory to an energy-saving mode. Directive 6: Make your way to the main lab in the Z17-45 area in groups of 3. Each group carries 1 set of documents. One guard is assigned to each group. Everybody must wear protective gear. Good luck, everyone. Laboratory Manager Prikhodko P.S., Head of the K.T.S. Laboratory

Posthumous note, dated April 26th, 2008. I, Prikhodko Pavel Stepanovich, head of the laboratory, born in 1976, being in my right mind, voluntarily pass away today. I want to explain the reasons why. I hope someone finds this note and passes it on to my loved ones and my colleagues to whom I remained loyal to until the end. Two weeks ago, I signed a mothballing order for our lab. After the events of April 12, the laboratory could no longer operate normally. Communication with the center was lost. Having reproduced the lab result materials, I sent four groups of my staff to the main lab. Some of them will make it, I believe. And the invaluable results of our work will not go to waste. This will benefit our GREAT cause. After this, I was left alone, and I loaded into our brainchild - the "Ya1-M" pseudo-brain, developed by us, the "Shroud of Darkness" program, which was supposed to make our ZX-16 psionic-defense complex inspire any thinking creature within 200 meters, the absolute invisibility of our laboratory, as well as on a subconscious level to inspire unease and apprehension in anyone who tries to approach it - hopefully preventing them from discovering the lab. Anyway, I'll be brief. I don't know why, but it wasn't the program that worked. When I tried to leave the psionic-protected room with the "brain", I received a intense, psionically-given order to defend the facility and kill all uninvited guests. When I woke up, I found myself back in the psionic shelter. I don't remember how I got back. Over the past 2 weeks that I've spent in this room - I've asked myself thousands of times, how could a program we just started developing work? The answer scares me. Perhaps the most fantastic hypothesis of my colleagues about the possibility of self-learning in Ya-1M worked. If so, that monster is probably grinning slyly at me right now. I tried to smash his hull, but to no avail. My PM can't do anything about that armored glass. And all the machine guns were taken away by our guards. The only way to shut down the complex now is at the backup control panel. I trapped myself. We ran out of water and provisions a week ago. If I leave the room - the psionic radiation will destroy me as a person, and my remaining short days will be spent living the life of an vegetable. I don't want this, so I saved the last bullet in my gun for myself. Good luck to everyone - Pavel. April 26, 2008. 13-40
A device that shows a map of the Cordon with numerous anomalous formations on it.

A device that measures and catalogs anomalous formations, along with documenting their locations accurately on satellite maps. To use this device, you must approach the anomaly, hold the device in your hands, and activate the device.

The GSh-18 is a Russian pistol developed in the late 1990s at the Tula Instrument Design Bureau. Its name comes from the initials of the surnames of the two designers who worked on it - Vasiliy P. Gryazev and Arkadiy G. Shipunov - and the '18' in its name comes from how many rounds its magazine holds.
Ammunition:
basic 9x19mm Parabellum,
enhanced 9x19mm PBP.
The dead corpse of a crow. You can eat this, but crows in the Zone are highly radioactive, so eating them is risky. You can cook this over a campfire.

Documents from an abandoned laboratory. They mention experiments carried out in the complex - one specific document that stands out has details related to experiments that lead to the creation of the Burer. There are also monthly reports on the work of scientific departments, lists of all scientific workers, project budgets, instructions for carrying out standard procedures, and so on. There is also talk about transferring the results of experiments to another complex. Judging by the coordinates, it's located somewhere at Yantar.
Digital lighting control. Control codes: 1 - on, 2 - off.
There's a blockage here. You can try to remove it.

A SUPER-series artifact detector. This detector is the one of the latest detectors developed by scientists working in the Zone. Thanks to advancements in nanotechnology, this device's scanning radius has been increased to 1.5 kilometers. This devices designates artifacts when they're detected by giving them markers and putting them on a relevant satellite map so that the user can figure their specific location. This detector also recognizes artifact types, using an artifact encyclopedia stored in the device's memory storage as a reference to check against, making this device the best artifact detector you can get.

A PRO-series artifact detector. This detector is an improved version of the INDY-series artifact detector, developed by scientists working in the Zone looking to improve on the artifact detection device they've developed. This arifact detector works by displaying a satellite map of the local area its user is in and tagging any detected artifacts with markers on the map, giving a precise estimation of their location. Additionally, the PRO-series artifact detector has had its scanning radius increased to 70 meters. Due to its reasonable price and improved performance, this detector is one of the most popular among stalkers in the Zone.

A INDY-series artifact detector. This device was the first artifact detector developed by scientists in the Zone. Its ineffective and outdated if compared to newer detectors because of its short detection radius, which is only 40 meters, and the fact that it only indicates the presence of artifacts with only an audiable beep that increases in intensity when its user gets closer to artifact it has detected. Despite this, this device was revolutionary when it was first introduced years ago, making artifact hunting much easier for stalkers.
Hey, dude! Come over here, we have some business to discuss!
This flashlight isn't working. I think the batteries in it are dead.
Turn off the power to the PSI installation.
The PSI installation's power is turned off.

The data in this PDA has been corrupted, but the audio journal entry in it is mostly intact: "Damn, I think my leg is broken.. it really hurts. Apparently the emitter is holed up in the basement, creating a blockage of psionic radiation. Unless we can get to the emitter's control panel and turn it off, there's no way down!. Shit... The door code is 8620. Good thing the Professor told me, just in case!"

The basic data in this PDA is encrypted, but you've managed to access a few documents concerning information about the lab. One document has details about a group of scientists who went to one of the labs at Lake Yantar to search for equipment. It states: "As we know, the staff left the lab in a disorganized and chaotic fashion - there's a lot of very interesting and useful research equipment, ranging from simple dosimeters and dynamometers to experimental weapons and equipment remained there. We'll probably find technical documentation, reports, maybe personal diaries of specialists. All of this should give at least a little insight into what was going on there. Who knows, maybe the information found there will help us bring about another scientific and technological revolution?" You should look for documents on the first and second levels of the complex, and equipment in the storage rooms. There's also a note from the Professor that says: "Be extremely vigilant and cautious as test specimens number 1 and 2, as well as the Alpha psionic specimen have disappeared. Maybe they're still in the lab."

A medium-sized scientific container, designed for carrying moderately dangerous artifacts. Despite its small size, it provides adequate protection from the anomalous energy and radiation that most artifacts have in the Zone. It's made of special heavy-duty plastic, and its outermost layer is coated with a special metal alloy developed at the mobile lab at Lake Yantar that has the same positive properties of lead - but better. These artifact containers are highly sought after by professional artifact hunters.

A medium-sized scientific container, designed for carrying more common and less dangerous artifacts. Despite its small size, it provides adequate protection against the radiation that most artifacts emit - but since this container is a more budget-orientated one, it provides zero protection against the anomalous effects more dangerous artifacts have. It's made of special heavy-duty plastic, and its outermost layer is coated with a special metal alloy developed at the mobile lab at Lake Yantar that has the same positive properties of lead - but better. These artifact containers are highly sought after by professional artifact hunters.

A medium-sized scientific container, designed for carrying highly dangerous artifacts. Despite its small size, it provides adequate protection against the intense anomalous energy or radiation that the most dangerous artifacts emit. It's made of special heavy-duty plastic, and its outermost layer is coated with a special metal alloy developed at the mobile lab at Lake Yantar that has the same positive properties of lead - but better. These artifact containers are highly sought after by professional artifact hunters.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains one artifact.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains two artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains three artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains four artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains five artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains six artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains seven artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains eight artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
The dead corpse of a rat. You can eat this, but rats in the Zone are highly radioactive, so eating them is risky. You can cook this over a campfire.

This specific backpack - a military surplus one that's rugged and waterproof, normally comes with the most common and popular stalker suit. You can take it off and use it to make a secret stash in a secluded place.

The RPK-74 was introduced in 1974 together with the AK-74 assault rifle and chambered for the then-new 5.45x39mm intermediate cartridge. It was derived from the AK-74 rifle, with modifications that mirror those made to the AKM to create the RPK. It was intended to replace the PK machine gun, but it never fully did so.

Ammunition:
5.45x35mm FMJ,
5.45x39mm AP

A semi-automatic shotgun of South African origin, originally designed for hunting big game in the African safari. It's compact and convenient, but it does have the major flaw of spewing hot gas in its user's face whenever the weapon fires. Regardless, it has found its way into the hands of firearm enthusiasts in the Zone.

 Ammunition:
 12x70 Buckshot,
 12x76mm Slug,
 12x76mm Dart
Stalker, this is Duty outpost! If you're going to go to the Bar, you can come through.

Oh, what a friendly stalker! You know, Journalist was also kind and helped me. I recall that one time I was at his place.. he told me a story that stuck with me.. oh, I'm getting sidetracked. Anyway, behind the power plant there are various installations that caused that big Emission that hit me years ago. Journalist also mentioned that he's scouring the local neighborhood for important documents that might give hom some clues. He said he wanted to find out what has happened in the Zone.
That's all you remember about Journalist? You don't know anything else?
No, that's all I remember about him. Thank you for your help, I think you'll find what you're looking for.
This device is a personal digital assistant - a small, handheld personal computer that has many uses, such as data management and storage.
Hey, stalker, come here! I'm in the house on the hill.
Stalker, you're in Duty territory. Don't you dare shoot or cause trouble here.
Toad: Messer, I've relocated to a bunker in the hills. Come visit me if you can.

We're thinking of doing a raid at Silent Hills. These dark ones are obviously up to something, so we need to do a little recon. The village to the west of the Hills will give us good cover. There's one problem though - there's a controller there. It must be destroyed.
I need to pick up Toad's box.

Stalker, it's Toad. I can't believe you've made it to nuclear power plant at Chernobyl. If you do decide to sneak inside in order to get to the Monolith, listen... The entrance to the reactor is behind the plant, on the north side. There's a pair of double gates. I hope you know what you're doing.

Stalker, it's Toad. I can't believe you've made it to nuclear power plant at Chernobyl. If you do decide to sneak inside in order to get to the Monolith, listen... The entrance to the reactor is behind the plant, on the north side. There's a pair of double gates. I hope you know what you're doing!
Who the hell is out there?
Quiet, quiet, it's all over now...

You mean the scientist from Yantar? Yeah, he lived here. He disappeared under mysterious circumstances recently. Our guys wanted to check out the apartment, but the door is jammed. One of our guys tried to get to the apartment by walking on top of the wires that lead to it a few times, but he kept falling off. He doesn't want to try again anymore... and it looks like the window's boarded up. I think we're going to have to break the door down, or blow things up.
Find the entrance to the laboratory.
The entrance to the main laboratory is located somewhere in the general vicinity of the Generators. You need to find the entrance to it.
Messer! My equipment indicates are that you are very close to the installation. Be careful!
Unknown Stalker: This area is closed to loners, but if you're here on business, come to our base.
The NPC doesn't have enough money.
Voting is not available on this server.
There are no active votes right now.
A polyethylene file that contains numerous documents.

Protective suit. Weight: 18kg. Details: Protects the body from Jelly, Burnt Fuzz, most anomalies and physical damage. The torso and back are protected by built-in bio-metallic plates. The suit is equipped with an airtight, reinforced plastic helmet and two oxygen bottles. Note: During extended periods of use the suit tears through and gradually deteriorates beyond use.

Protective suit. Weight: 8 kg. Details: Protects the body from weak anomalies and physical damage. Equipped with an oxygen mask. Note: During extended periods of use the suit tears through and gradually deteriorates beyond use.

Protective suit. Weight: 12 kg. Details: Protects the user from Jelly, Burnt Fuzz, many anomalies and physical damage. Equipped with an airtight helmet and an oxygen bottle. Note: During extended periods of use the suit tears through and gradually deteriorates beyond use.

An "EXP-4" scientific protective suit with an airtight red helmet. Weighs 11 kg. It protects the body from fire, acid gases, a variety of anomalies (including "Burnt Fuzz"), and mechanical damage. Equipped with two oxygen cylinders. Warning: with continuous use it will become damaged and torn.
Army binoculars with adjustable (up to 7.5 diopters) magnification.

An outdated, first-generation anomaly detector. It emits a light when it detects anomalies. The distance to the anomaly is indicated by the how frequently the light emits. To ensure reliability, readings should be done when stationary.
- does not detect all anomalies
- can give false or inaccurate readings
- If you have this device, you can scan items in your backpack for radiation.

A device that detects the presence of anomalous formations. The distance to the anomaly is indicated by the how frequently the light emits. To ensure reliability, readings should be done when stationary.\nMaxinum number of anomalies that can be detected and registered simultaneously - 3.\nDetection radius - 10 meters.

A device that detects the presence of anomalous formations, along with hot pockets of radiation. The distance to the anomaly is indicated by the how frequently the light emits. To ensure reliability, readings should be done when stationary.\nMaxinum number of anomalies that can be detected and registered simultaneously - 4.\nDetection radius - 15 meters.
A PDA is an indispensable device in the Zone for any stalker, useful for things such as cataloging data or maintaining a journal.
A flashlight that has a fairly powerful bulb. Quite useful at nighttime or in areas with little or no lighting.

A flashlight that has a fairly powerful bulb. Quite useful at nighttime or in areas with little or no lighting. The voltage regulator in this flashlight has been replaced with a better one, so it takes considerably less time to recharge its battery.
An opioid-based medication used to treat pain, used by many stalkers in the Zone as a quick fix. However, it can be habit-forming, and taking it with alcohol can have adverse effects.

No bakers have ever been identified in the Zone - so it's safe to assume that this bread comes from the Big Land, but it's neither contaminated nor radioactive, being fresh and quite edible. At least no complaints have been reported thus far.

Presumably, these canned rations were looted by stalkers from an army ration depot. Without any kind of label on the can, it's hard to say for sure. Should still be good to eat, if you believe the best before date.
For better or worse, this sausage - a mix of chicken and a soy substitute - is often a stalker's breakfast, lunch and dinner in one. Can be stored for a long time due to high preservative content.

Vodka made by GSC. Goes down easy and considerably lowers the effects of radiation. Should be enjoyed in moderation.
Loss of coordination.
Slightly relieves the effects of radiation sickness.
Quenches thirst.

Perfectly filters out radionuclides from the body and reduces the impact of absorbed radiation. There's also a supplied bar of hematogen in a separate packet.\nPossible loss of coordination.\Provides treatment for radiation sickness.

A normal elastic bandage used to stop bleeding and prevent infection of wounds. For regular bleeding, carefully apply the bandage to the wound. For arterial bleeding, urgently tie the bandage around the affected area.
A general purpose single-use medical kit. Handy for treating various injuries - wounds, bruises, regular and chemical burns and various types of poisoning. In demand among stalkers.
A specialized medical kit for dealing with physical injuries and bleeding. Packed full of blood coagulants, painkillers, antibiotics and immunostimulants.

A medical kit designed specifically for use in the Zone. The kit contains products for handling wounds, as well as preventing the development of radiation poisoning and reducing accumulated radiation in the body. Contains Vikasolum, Batilolum and Naphazoline, unlike other medkits.
This detector is designed to detect anomalous formations, as well as hot spots of radioactive contamination.
A regular six-string guitar. Stalkers enjoy playing a tune while sitting around a campfire.
A regular harmonica, the simplest musical instrument in the Zone.
A handheld flashlight that has increased brightness and illumination range.

A super-precise weapon, put together by gunsmiths living in the Zone. This weapon uses energy from an embedded artifact to help propel rounds at incredibly high velocities. Despite how lethal this weapon is, it has almost no recoil. This specific specimen is one of the first prototypes of the Gauss rifle.\nAmmunition - Gauss rounds.
These gauss rifle magazines consist of both rounds and a battery using a capsulated fragment of an energy artifact as a power source. Manufactured using high-tech equipment.

The OTs-12 Tiss is a Russian assault rifle, based on the AKS-74U and developed by the Central Design and Research Bureau of Sporting and Hunting Arms at Tula. The OTs-12's key difference is that it's chambered for the subsonic 9x39mm round, which entailed changes in the barrel, gas system, bolt, and magazine. The sights and recoil compensator have also been modified.

A full-length version of the TOZ-66 shotgun. It has good accuracy and is devastating at close and medium range, being suitable for hunting various mutants - or killing hostile stalkers or bandits. The TOZ-66 is often seen in the hands of rookies, and merchants always hold them in stock for sale.
 
 Ammunition:
 12x70 shot,
 12x76mm slug,
 12x76mm dart.
An experimental weapon of unknown origin.\nCan be loaded with 2-millimeter gauss ammunition.

The VSK-94 (Voyskovoy Snayperskiy Kompleks, or Military Sniper Complex) is a Russian sniper rifle based on the compact 9A-91 assault rifle, developed by the Tula Instrument Design Bureau in 1994, serving as a suppressed designated marksman rifle.
An anomalous 7.62x54mmR round that's had a piece of the Gravi artifact embedded in it, improving its ballistic performance.

The PP-19 Bizon SMG was designed in the early 1990s at the Izhevsk Machine Building Plant. The Ministry of Internal Affairs needed a new, modern SMG to arm its operatives with to replace or supplement the AKS-74U, and the Bizon was the end result of their request for a new SMG. The PP-19 has proven itself to be a reliable design, using a modified variation of the system Mikhail T. Kalashnikov developed for his AK rifle. 
- 9x18mm, 9x18mm BMP
- effective range 100m
- magazine capacity: 64 cartridges

The M134 is a six-barrel machine gun that uses an electrically driven rotation mechanism, giving it a very high rate of fire. Since this weapon is very heavy and impractical to use as a hand weapon, it can only be used with a hydraulic exoskeleton. Inside the Zone, it's extremely rare due how inconvenient it is to use because of its heavy weight. The Ukrainian army uses to defend the perimeter against swarms of mutants.

The weapon - an older version of the OTs-14-4A Groza, is a prototype consisting of a 9x39mm bullpup assault rifle integrated with a 40mm underbarrel grenade launcher. Its automatic mechanism functions by channeling gas from the barrel, locking it with a rotating bolt. Notably, this prototype addresses common bullpup design issues, such as center-of-mass displacement and the problematic extractor placement near the users face. These problems traditionally make bullpup rifles difficult for left-handed shooters to use, as hot cartridges eject close to the face. The grenade launcher attachment helps balance the weapon, mitigating the center-of-mass issue. Additionally, a unique casing ejection system channels spent cartridges forward through a designated path, ejecting them near the pistol grip on the right side. This innovative solution allows the weapon to be used comfortably by both right-handed and left-handed shooters. This forward ejection method was later adopted in the Belgian FN F2000 rifle. The prototypes closed receiver design also enhances reliability by protecting the internal mechanisms from dirt and debris.
A underbarrel grenade launcher for the AKS-74 prototype.

This weapon is a prototype of the AKS-74 assault rifle. It's often found used by military stalkers. The Kalashnikov 5.45mm assault rifle, developed and designed in 1974, is a 5.45x39mm caliber assault rifle designed in 1970 by Soviet designer Mikhail T. Kalashnikov and adopted by the Red Army in 1974. It's a further development of the AKM, being a more refined design.
 Ammunition:
5.45x35mm FMJ,
5.45x39mm AP

A Kalashnikov-type assault rifle, chambered for 5.45x39mm. It was first proposed in 1970 by designer Mikhail T. Kalashnikov as a further development of the AKM, and after four years of trials, study, and research it was officially adopted by the armed forces of the USSR in 1974.
 Ammunition:
5.45x35mm FMJ,
5.45x39mm AP

The Igla is a third-generation MANPADS. It works both in the conditions of natural (background) heat and artificial interference (spoofing countermeasures). To this day, it remains one of the best systems in its class. 
 
 Usage:
 Activate the ground power supply.
 5 seconds will proceed until the missile is prepared for combat, which consists of cooling down the homing head to working temperature and rotating the tracking system gyroscope.
 Aim the launcher at the target. When the target appears in the field of view of the homing head, a stream of thermal radiation enters the coordinator. If the flow is greater than the minimum sensitivity of the coordinator, a sound signal plays. The target is locked on, and the launch tube is opened.
 When the sound signal plays, the missile is launched. The power supply maintains operation for about 40 seconds after being turned on. If no missile is launched during this time period, the missile is rendered unusable. Locking onto a target at an angle less than 20 degrees between the target and the sun is impossible.
 
 Ammunition:
Igla missile

A heat-seeking missile that's used by the Igla MANPADS. The missile uses a two-channel infrared GOS system, which allows for the heak-seeking system to differentiate between natural and artificial thermal noise. When the rocket impacts something, or is in close proximity to a target, the detonation fuse will go off. To improve fuel efficiency, the rocket itself uses a two-stage ignition system so it can maintain flight for extended periods of time.

Rumor has it that this gun was found in a pile of rust in the Garbage, right in the middle of where a gravity anomaly had been for three months. Surprisingly, the gun itself is in good condition. Despite how heavily it was used, there's no noticeable wear and tear.
 
Features: Because of its unique interaction with the Zone, this gun is much more inferior to conventional Kalashnikov's in terms of accuracy and damage, but its more easy and mobile to use.
 
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.45x35mm,
 armor-piercing 5.45x39mm BP

A gauss rifle that comes with a enlarged detachable magazine, having a larger capacity of rounds.
 
 Ammunition:
 Gauss rounds.
The personal knife from a stalker named 'Scrap'. The handle is badly worn, but if you hold it, you'll notice that it fits perfectly in your hand.
A halogen light. This is an experimental prototype, so it's possible it'll malfunction.

A SVU bullpup sniper rifle that has been modified to have a greater rate of fire, at the expense of poorer accuracy.

Ammunition:
7.62x54mmR 7N1,
7.62x54mmR BP,
7.62x54mmR 7N14

This specific G36 has been altered by spraying powder from a grounded up gravitational artifact onto the barrel, improving overall accuracy.

Ammunition:
5.56x45mm SS109,
5.56x45mm AP

Grenade launcher ammunition:
M209 grenade

This Vintorez has a dedication to honor the memory of a deceased stalker written on the side. In addition to the inscription, various adjustments were made to the weapon, which result in superior accuracy, but poorer reliability.

Ammunition:
9x39mm PAB-9,
9x39mm SP-6,
9x39mm SP-5

This Beretta has been modified by gunsmiths who work for scientists in the Zone. It has better reliability, making it a popular choice with scientists who need a handgun that is easy to use and can withstand the Zone's conditions.

Ammunition:
9x19mm FMJ,
9x19mm JHP

The .45 ACP caliber full metal jacket round, used by the Colt M1911, Sig-Sauer P220, USP Compact, and the Desert Eagle has enjoyed popularity for more than a hundred years thanks to its heavy bullet and a relatively small propelling charge. As a result, the bullet in this round is relatively slow but highly accurate and provides considerable stopping power.

This unusual .45 ACP caliber round, used by the Colt M1911, Sig-Sauer P220, USP Compact, and the Desert Eagle, is comprised of a jacketed soft point bullet with an expanding hollow and a steel core. It is a combination of jacketed expanding soft point and armor piercing bullets, benefiting, from the advantages of both and, suffering from their downsides.

Standard 12-gauge round filled with 6mm shot. Highly lethal at close range. Only suitable for use with smoothbore weapons - specifically the TOZ-34, the TOZ-66, the Maverick 88, the SPAS-12, and the Striker.

A specialized shotgun round that's similiar to a slug, but more pointed. Its fins add stability, resulting in increased accuracy. The massive steel body of the bullet can penetrate any body armor. This round is used by 12-gauge shotguns - the TOZ-34, the TOZ-66, the Maverick 88, the SPAS-12, and the Striker.

This heavy 12-gauge slug round is normally used for hunting big game, but is also good for other purposes. Instead of piercing, this hefty slug simply crushes through armor. It's used by 12-gauge shotguns - the TOZ-34, the TOZ-66, the Maverick 88, the SPAS-12, and the Striker. Its maximum effective range is around 100 meters.

This cartridge is a 5.45x39 caliber armor-piercing round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries, and in the Zone it's used by the AK-74, the RPK-74, the AKS-74U, and the AKS-74 prototype. The bullet contains a hard-alloy armor piercing penetrator. Effective against body armor.

This cartridge is a 5.45x39 caliber improved piercing round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries, and in the Zone it's used by the AK-74, the RPK-74, the AKS-74U, and the AKS-74 prototype. It provides better accuracy than the 7.62x39mm caliber rounds thanks to its reduced recoil and a 100 meter increase in range.

A common NATO military 5.56x45 caliber armor piercing round, known under its SS190/M855 index, widely used by Western security agencies and special services. In the Zone, this round is used by the for the L85A1, the LR-300, the SG-550, the G36, the FN-2000, and the M134. Effective against body armor.

A standard issue NATO 5.56x45mm caliber round specially designed for accurate automatic fire, known under its SS109 index. Provides good ballistic characteristics, having been designed on the basis of a hunting round. In the Zone, this round is used by the for the L85A1, the LR-300, the SG-550, the G36, the FN-2000, and the M134.

This cartridge is a 7.62x54mmR caliber sniper round with a steel penetrator that was specially designed for the SVD sniper rifle, and it can also be used by the SVU sniper rifle, the PKM light machine gun, and 7.62x39mm AK rifles that have been rechambered to accept this cartridge. Unlike the machine gun round, the 7N1 provides tight groupings and excellent penetration.

This cartridge is a more specialized 7.62x.54mmR caliber high precision armor-piercing sniper round. In the Zone, this round is used by the SVD and the SVU sniper rifles, the PKM light machine gun, and 7.62x39mm AK rifles that have been rechambered to accept this cartridge.

This 7.62x54mmR caliber round has an armor-piercing bullet, making it effective at taking out armored targets from a distance. In the Zone, this round is used by the SVD and the SVU sniper rifles, the PKM light machine gun, and 7.62x39mm AK rifles that have been rechambered to accept this cartridge.
