A full metal jacket round with a steel penetrator and a lead core under a metal jacket. In the Zone, this round is used by the Makarov PM, the PB, the Fort-12, and the Stechkin APS. Provides good stopping power but is ineffective against body armor.

This round contains a bullet with enhanced stopping power, while its European +P+ designation indicates "overpressure ammunition" with a 30% increase in muzzle velocity. While somewhat more effective against body armor, it's still fairly underwhelming against armored targets. In the Zone, this round is used by the Makarov PM, the PB, the Fort-12, and the Stechkin APS.

A round with a jacketed soft point bullet that deforms slightly on impact instead of expanding, giving it a limited armor piercing effect. In the Zone, this round is used by the Makarov PM, the PB, the Fort-12, and the Stechkin APS.

This basic 9x19mm caliber round with a jacketed bullet has good characteristics while being simple to produce. The round is popular due to the fact that international conventions prohibit the use of expanding ammunition in combat. Ineffective against body armor. In the Zone, this round is used by the Browning HP, the Walther P99, the Beretta 92FS, and the GSh-18.

This 9x19mm caliber round has a jacketed hollow point bullet with an expanding, hollow interior. This provides high stopping power and low ricochet propensity. Used by police and for self-defense. Ineffective against body armor due to its low penetration potential. In the Zone, this round is used by the Browning HP, the Walther P99, the Beretta 92FS, and the GSh-18.

The SP-6 is a subsonic assault rifle round with a jacketed soft point bullet with a hard steel core that protrudes from the casing. Requires a silencer for stealth firing. Used by special services of Warsaw Pact countries. Effective against body armor. In the Zone, this round is used by the VSS Vintorez, the AS Val, the OTs-14 Groza (and its prototype), and the VSK-94.

The PAB-9 is a subsonic sniper round with a bimetallic casing. The round contains a steel core with a gap behind it that is filled with lead. Requires a silencer for stealth firing. Used by special services of Warsaw Pact countries. In the Zone, this round is used by the VSS Vintorez, the AS Val, the OTs-14 Groza (and its prototype), and the VSK-94.

A sniper round for the VSS Vintorez, the AS Val, the OTs-14 Groza (and its prototype), and the VSK-94. It has a subsonic bullet which, due to its heavy weight and specialized design - it can penetrate most bulletproof vests at a range of up to 400 meters.

These gauss rifle magazines consist of both rounds and a battery using a capsulated fragment of an energy artifact as a power source. They are manufactured using high-tech equipment and are meant for the Gauss-GSG5 rifle.
The M209 is a 40 mm grenade for the M203 underbarrel grenade launcher. It has a 5 meter kill zone, and it's also used by the integrated underbarrel grenade launcher that's used by the FN-2000.
The PG-7VL is a high explosive, tandem charge warhead grenade that's for the RPG-7V. It's devastating against mutants, stalkers, troops, and lightly armored vehicles.

The VOG-25 is a fragmentation grenade for the GP-25 Kostyor underbarrel grenade launcher. This grenade has an effective radius of five meters. The VOG-25 grenade is also used by the OTs-14 Groza's underbarrel grenade launcher (along with its prototype), and RG-6 revolving grenade launcher.

The VOG-25R is a improved fragmentation grenade for the GP-25 Kostyor underbarrel grenade launcher. This grenade has effective radius of five meters - but fefore detonation, the grenade jumps up to a height of about a meter, which increases its lethality. The VOG-25R grenade is also used by the OTs-14 Groza's underbarrel grenade launcher (along with its prototype), and RG-6 revolving grenade launcher.

A defensive hand grenade, with fragments capable of piercing medium-level body armor. The grenade has an effective range of 7 meters. Stalkers get F1 grenades from trading with the military bureaucrats, who write them off as having been used for fighting mutants.
A smoke grenade. These are used to put up smoke screens, which serves as an effective means of visual cover. Once the grenade is thrown it takes around 10 seconds for the smoke screen to expand.
An offensive hand grenade with a small effective range of 5 meters. These are often used by stalkers to "smoke out" mutants due to its relatively low cost.

The AKMS is an variant of the AKM that has folding metal buttstock, making it lighter and smaller. The way the buttstock attaches to the rifle has also been revised if compared to the AKS, being more refined in design. The buttstock has also been raised to change the point of rest, making it easy to zero in on targets. The AKMS, like the original AKS rifle, was designed to give Soviet paratroopers a lighter AK rifle. Most, if not all 7.62x36mm AK rifles in the Zone have been rechambered by gunsmiths living in the Zone to accept the 7.62x54mmR cartridge, making the weapon more deadly.

Ammunition:
7.62x54mmR 7N1,
7.62x54mmR 7N14,
7.62x54mmR BP
Machine gun supplied with a modified optic sight for carrying out sniper fire. The optics embedded into the body of the weapon has a higher resolution than the standard model.
This assault rifle is equipped with an integrated underbarrel grenade launcher, making this weapon even more versatile.

A single shot, front loaded, rifled underbarrel grenade launcher for assault rifles made in Warsaw Pact countries. The firing mechanism is self-cocking, with a manual safety catch and automatic shot prevention if incorrectly installed onto a rifle.

Ammunition:
VOG-25 grenade
VOG-25R grenade

A modified M203 grenade launcher that has been shortened by three inches, attached to weapons by means of a Picatinny rail. Thanks to a changed mount, this grenade launcher is widely used around the world.

Ammunition:
M209 grenade
The PSO-1 is a very common Soviet-made optical scope. It attaches to weapons by means of a Dovetail mount, which is standard for weapons used by former Warsaw Pact countries.

A 4x fixed zoom scope produced primarily in Western countries. It attaches to weapons by means of the NATO-standardized Picatinny rail. Often used for accurate fire from small arms at medium to long range.

An effective silencer which can be modified on the go as required. The body of the silencer around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal diaphragms with holes for the bullet to pass through. The set includes adaptors and sealants for most weapons. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.

This weapon, designed in 1974, signaled the adoption of small caliber and low impulse rounds by Warsaw Pact countries. A descendant of the most popular assault rifle in the world, the AKS-74 has an even bigger muzzle brake, resulting in a reduction of what was already manageable recoil. This facilitates better accuracy and groupings, especially when fired in fast single shots or bursts. As before, the rifle is very simple and reliable.
Ammunition:
5.45x39mm FMJ,
5.45x39mm BP

This Kalashnikov has a modified bolt and gas system, increasing its rate of fire.
Ammunition:
5.45x39mm FMJ,
5.45x39mm BP

Despite being similar to submachineguns in size, weight and tactical purpose, this weapon is classified as an assault rifle due to the fact that its internal mechanism is identical to that of the AK-74. The weapon is notable for its mobility in close quarters and high armor-penetration capacity, while its drawbacks are its short effective range, despite the relatively long bullet range, a tendency to overheat and high ricochet propensity.
Ammunition:
5.45x39mm FMJ,
5.45x39mm BP

Beretta pistols enjoy the reputation of a relatively reliable, albeit somewhat cumbersome weapon, around the world. It's in service with many armies and law enforcement organizations across the world. The Beretta pistol is equally popular with members of the underworld, thanks to its powerful round and magazine capacity. Berettas found in the Zone are usually dated, probably from retired stock.

Ammunition:
9x19mm FMJ,
9x19mm JHP

The TOZ-66 is a side-by-side shotgun, originally designed for hunting animals, but it's also lethally effective at putting down hostile stalkers or soldiers. It has good accuracy for close to medium ranges. The TOZ-66 is often seen in the hands of rookies, and merchants always hold them in stock for sale.

 Ammunition:
 12x70 Buckshot,
 12x76mm Slug,
 12x76mm Dart

An improved version of the classic Colt 1911 automatic pistol, which passed all the major armed conflicts of the 20th century with flying colors and entered the new millennium with confidence. Produced by dozens if not hundreds of arms manufacturers around the world in both standard and modified configurations. The weapon's only drawback, its mediocre magazine capacity, is largely compensated by the hard-hitting ammo it uses.

 Ammunition:
.45 ACP,
.45 ACP Hydra-Shock

The Desert Eagle is the ultimate hand cannon - bulky, heavy and highly lethal. It was developed as a specialized weapon for hunting medium-sized and large game, as well as for shooting competitions involving firing at steel body targets at distances over 50 meters. Its limited use in the Zone can be attributed to its price, size and weight, which are all double those of other pistols.

Ammunition:
.45 ACP,
.45 ACP Hydra-Shock

This futuristic-looking weapon with a bullpup layout is actually a mass produced modular system, comprising a rifle grenade complex with a computerized fire control system and a 40-mm grenade launcher. Despite its bulky appearance, the weapon is highly ergonomic, easy to use and benefits from good reliability.

Ammunition:
5.56x45mm SS109,
5.56x45mm AP,
M209 grenade

A Ukranian-made pistol predominantly used by law enforcement organizations. Compared to the Makarov PM, the Fort-12 has better higher accuracy, better ergonomics and has a larger magazine. These pistols make it into the Zone in large numbers thanks to the sale of defective weapons, which suffer from technical flaws in early design models. Despite this, the pistol is in demand among stalkers thanks to its good combat characteristics.

Ammunition:
9x18mm FMJ,
9x18mm +P+,
9x18mm PBP

The G36 is a new addition to the Western-made assault rifle family, which differs significantly from previous models in the series built on an automatic foundation with a semi-open bolt assembly, this weapon is more like American automatic gas-operated assault rifles with a short-stroke gas piston system. These changes ensure that the rifle is a first-rate example of a modern weapon - lightweight, reliable and ergonomic.

Ammunition:
5.56x45mm SS109,
5.56x45mm AP (start here for your first session on 9/5/24 and don't forget to remove this reminder when you start)

This gauss rifle is a highly accurate, technologically advanced weapon. It was developed in secret laboratories located inside the Zone. The weapon operates by accelerating bullets to extremely high speeds using a system of electromagnets, which provides incredible stopping power with virtually no recoil. The weapon is powered by using capsulated artifact fragments stored in the batteries.\nAmmunition: Gauss rounds

This assault rifle combined with a grenade launcher, which is similar to the AK series, was specifically developed for rapid response units. The main differences are its 9x39mm caliber ammunition, bullpup layout and extensive configuration options. This weapon is highly valued by military stalkers due to its ability to kill enemies wearing body armor behind improvised cover at a distance during urban combat, as well as its excellent stopping power.
Ammunition:
9x39mm SP-5
9x39mm SP-6
9x39mm PAB-9
VOG-25
VOG-25R

A modified version of the Browning Hi-Power pistol from the first half of the 20th century, which is as reliable, powerful and accurate as the original. Pistols of this series deserve their reputation as one of the best handguns of the 20th century and are in great demand in the Zone.

Ammunition:
9x19mm FMJ,
9x19mm JHP
A hunting knife. If you need to take someone out quietly, this knife is the perfect weapon for the job.

This rifle's considerable number of drawbacks caused most of these weapons to be modernized, with the retired stock making its way to the Zone via the black market. The L85's main advantages are its built-in 4x scope and high single-shot accuracy. When the weapon is fired in bursts, its accuracy decreases significantly and the rifle's basic internal mechanisms become somewhat unreliable.

Ammunition:
5.56x45mm SS109,
5.56x45mm AP

The LR-300 is the latest weapon from the Z-M Weapons company owned by Allan Zitta. Allan is well known for his extensive experience in developing new pistols based on Colt M1911. The LR-300 is a new stage in the AR-15's development. LR-300 stands for 'Light Rifle, 300 meters' - indicating that its maximum effective range is 300 meters. The upper and lower receiver support a new type of interconnecting operation-rod gas system, which allows for a short barrel and folding stock, giving the weapon its compact profile. One of the features of its new gas system is its diverted recoil, which helps to keep the weapon on target with no muzzle climb. 

Ammunition:
5.56x45mm SS109,
5.56x45mm AP

This submachine gun has gained popularity around the world thanks to its reliability, ease of use and accuracy. Over the last few decades the MP5 was in service with special armed forces and police units worldwide. Not surprisingly, having flooded the global black markets, it eventually made its way to the Zone.

Ammunition:
9x19mm FMJ,
9x19mm JHP

The HK 53 is a carbine variant of the HK 33KA3 with a shortened barrel that's 221 millimeters long, a extended flash supressor and forend that's similar to HK MP5. No underbarrel grenade launcher or bayonet knife can be installed. This weapon has been manufactured since 1975 and is mainly used by special forces.

Ammunition:
5.56x45mm SS109,
5.56x45mm AP

This pistol, a variant of the Makarov PM, was developed in the second half of the 20th century for special forces and recon units. The front of the pistol's barrel is has an integrated silencer attached to it, while the bolt mechanism is short, which prevents a back-moving spring from being located inside it, and it is therefore situated in the weapon's handle. Although obsolete, the weapon is still effective in the right hands.
Ammunition:
9x18mm FMJ,
9x18mm +P+,
9x18mm PBP

Designed and manufactured by Izhevsk Machine Engineering Plant in Russia for police and military armament since 1951, this Soviet legacy is the most common pistol in the Zone and is one of the best compact self-defense handguns available. It is small, highly reliable, easy to use and maintain in working order. It also suffers from several drawbacks, including its short range, low firing accuracy and poor stopping power, while also losing out to modern pistols in its class in terms of weight and magazine size.
Ammunition:
9x18mm FMJ,
9x18mm +P+,
9x18mm PBP

This revolver-type grenade launcher uses six rifled front-loading barrels, identical to underbarrel launcher attachments. The drum is also front-loading. The RG-6 is widely used for rapid suppression of enemy positions and, when in the open, attacking defended fixed targets or fighting particularly tough monsters.

Ammunition:
VOG-25 grenade
VOG-25R grenade

This grenade launcher from the 1960s made its way into the Zone from army depots. The RPG-7V is a smoothbore, single-shot, recoilless rocket launcher system with an open-rear tube. It comes with a PGO-7 x2.8 optical scope. Although its huge size and weight make it an unlikely choice for stalkers, given its huge destructive power and ease of use, it has found admirers in the Zone.

Ammunition:
PG-7VL warhead

The SIG-Sauer P220 is the only remaining mass produced model of the globally renowned P220 series. This weapon has earned a reputation for its excellent ergonomics and accuracy, and while its magazine is relatively small, it benefits from powerful ammo and a mechanism that functions like a Swiss watch. Some believe the P220 to be the best mass produced .45 ACP caliber handgun there is and it has certainly got a following among experienced stalkers and mercenaries.

 Ammunition:
.45 ACP,
.45 ACP Hydra-Shock

The SIG SG 550 is relatively new assault rifle that has quickly found admirers around the world, despite lacking a "trendy" design. Weapons of this series are one of the best in their class, renowned for their reliability, accuracy and ease of use. Despite being relatively difficult to obtain in the Zone, this assault rifle is often ordered by experienced stalkers at considerable expense.

Ammunition:
5.56x45mm SS109,
5.56x45mm AP

The SPAS-12 is a smoothbore automatic shotgun was designed in the second half of the 20th century and it comes with both pump-action and semi-automatic firing modes. It's used as an all-purpose weapon by the police and assault troops and is notable for its reliability and tactical flexibility. Despite its large weight, complex mechanism and considerable cost it is in demand in the Zone due to its effectiveness against mutants.

 Ammunition:
 12x70 Buckshot,
 12x76mm Slug,
 12x76mm Dart

An army sniper rifle that has been on the market for more than fifty years and has earned its reputation for exceptional reliability and ease of use. The SVD is normally used by armies in countries that are part of the ex-USSR to improve the effective range of its units, but stalkers respect this weapon for its armor-piercing properties, which allows it to penetrate mutant hide and anti-ballistic body armor.

Ammunition:
7.62x54mmR 7N1,
7.62x54mmR 7N14,
7.62x54mmR BP

A modernized version of the SVD sniper rifle that's a compact, bullpup version of it - made to the specifications of Russian special forces units. It allows faster precision fire and is considerably lighter, while its single shot firing accuracy at short and medium range is similar to that of its predecessor. These qualities have earned it the admiration of countless stalkers.

Ammunition:
7.62x54mmR 7N1,
7.62x54mmR 7N14,
7.62x54mmR BP

The TOZ-34 is a extremely common over-and-under hunting shotgun, offering better protection against mutants than a pistol, thanks to its accuracy and stopping power. It's used mostly by rookies on the outskirts of the Zone. It has been in production since 1964 at the Tula Arms Plant.

 Ammunition:
 12x70 Buckshot,
 12x76mm Slug,
 12x76mm Dart

Impeccable reliability and durability combined with excellent accuracy are the main noteworthy features of the USP Compact. Its minor drawbacks include its considerable size, relatively high center of gravity and massive bolt, which make it difficult to conceal but do not outweigh the weapon's positive features. The weapon is especially popular with the Zone's veterans.

 Ammunition:
.45 ACP,
.45 ACP Hydra-Shock

A modified version of the silent Vintorez sniper rifle, this assault rifle was designed as a weapon meant for special forces. The rifle's primary purpose is effective fire against enemies employing modern personal protection equipment without revealing the shooter's location. Thanks to its integrated silencer and 9x39mm caliber round with a heavy subsonic bullet, the weapon's noise and muzzle flash have been reduced to a minimum.

Ammunition:
9x39mm PAB-9,
9x39mm SP-6,
9x39mm SP-5

The VSS Vintorez is a specialized military sniper rifle purpose-built for silent, flashless sniping during special operations where avoiding early detection of the shooter may be critical. It provides high armor-piercing capability and stopping power, as well as being equipped with an integrated sniper and optical scope. Highly rated by many stalkers despite its small magazine.

Ammunition:
9x39mm PAB-9,
9x39mm SP-6,
9x39mm SP-5

The Walther P99 is a excellent Western pistol known for its reliability, high capacity magazine and good accuracy, as well as being among the most ergonomic handguns in its class. One of the most widely used pistols in the Zone, both among professionals and rookies who can afford it.

Ammunition:
9x19mm FMJ,
9x19mm JHP

The Mossberg Maverick 88 is a Western smoothbore shotgun that is extremely popular around the world due to its great reliability and quick reloading speed. It's particularly valued for its functionality by the Zone's hunters. All of its parts are coated with an anticorrosion compound.

 Ammunition:
 12x70 Buckshot,
 12x76mm Slug,
 12x76mm Dart
A stalker nicknamed Crowbar used to work as a mechanic in a locksmith factory. He made various small improvements to this AK-74, increasing its rate of fire.

A hybrid version of the VSS Vintorez and the AS Val, combining the best features of both weapons. This weapon has a 20-round magazine and very accurate automatic fire. The rifle's 2x scope is tailored for short to medium-range combat. Additionally, the trigger mechanism has been modified to reduce wear and tear during firing.

Ammunition:
9x39mm PAB-9,
9x39mm SP-6,
9x39mm SP-5
RG-6 (start here for your second session on 9/22/24 and don't forget to remove this reminder when you start)

Unshortened version of the BM-16 shotgun. It is distinguished from the Obrez by its greater nastiness and accuracy. Suitable for hunting boars and larger animals. Often seen in rookies and on sale at merchants.
Ammunition:
12x70 buckshot,
12x76 javelin,
12x76 dart.

Belgian submachine gun developed in the 1980s by FN Herstal. Despite its unusual appearance, it is quite effective. In the Zone, the FN P90 was fairly quickly redesigned for a special 5.56x45mm cartridge with more penetrating power than other pistol cartridges. The gun is easy to use and has extremely low recoil.
Ammunition:
conventional 5.56x45mm SS109,
armor-piercing 5.56x45mm AR.

Such weapons are usually equipped with heavily armed squads of military stalkers. It is extremely rare in the Zone, due to its large size and weight, which sometimes requires wearing an exoskeleton to shoot from hand.\nAmmunition:\narmor-piercing 7.62x54 mm BP.

APS is an automatic pistol developed in the late 1940s and early 1950s and adopted by the Soviet Armed Forces in 1951, at the same time as the Makarov pistol. APS is intended for arming officers taking direct part in combat operations, as well as for soldiers and sergeants of some special units.
- 9x18mm, 9x18mm BMP
- effective range 100m
- magazine capacity 20 rounds\
Description: A super-powered psi wave emitter of unknown type. It looks like an ordinary lamp.

Description: Has interesting and unpredictable properties. For example, it increases resistance to breakouts. Rumor has it that if you fall asleep with this artifact being zombified, the disease can recede and the artifact itself will disappear...
Description: a valuable and rare artifact. The object of sale, studied properties has no properties, except one - increases the body's resistance to high temperatures.

Description: an anomalous object of unknown origin. Something that looked like a thick pen, dark in color with a grayish pattern on the surface. Radiates warmth - you can feel it even through the gloves of your protective coveralls. Increases the weight carried by 3 kg.
Description: an anomalous object of unknown origin, resembling a spiral. When worn on the belt, it causes a feeling of drowsiness.
Description: transparent objects valuable from an aesthetic point of view.

Description: The only artifact of its kind. The straight metal rod is 43 cm long. On one of the sides you can see the numbers "2465" clearly printed. Properties: Capable of quenching any type of energy without changing shape or showing any primary signs (heating or cooling). Non-radioactive, no hazardous effects have been identified. Application: Object of scientific research.
A human skull, but made of a strange material. It's moving a bit, there are some fastenings in the eye sockets.
Description: Artifact with the negative properties of the host's influence.
Description: a shrunken larva of an unknown insect inside a glass oval. Has a strange property of saturating its host.

An artifact of third-degree anomalous luminosity. Properties are unknown except one - increases resistance to radiation. It is well known that artifacts of the anomalous luminosity class can react anomalously with other artifacts of that class.
An artifact of the third degree of anomalous luminosity

Artifact #460. An object with a negative degree of anomalous luminosity. Properties unknown. It is well known that artifacts of the anomalous luminosity class can react anomalously with other artifacts of that class.
An artifact of unknown origin. A poorly studied specimen. It has the property of increasing the muscle tone of the wearer, so you can move around longer.
An artifact of unknown origin. It has the property of increasing the muscle tone of the wearer, so you can move around longer. Prone to degeneration with prolonged use.
A viscous substance. Ultra-hazardous colonies of mutated bacteria.\nSpecificity: very dangerous anomalous formation, store only in a secure container such as an R1 capsule.
The result of artifact modification. Has boosted properties of parental artifacts, including negative ones.
The result of genetic modification of artifact jelly. Protects against exposure to parasitic spores, eliminates the possibility of contracting the disease.
Chaser Modification. A small fragment of Gravi artifact was embedded in the under-barrel ammunition receptacle, oriented in such a way as to increase the bullet's flight velocity.
This formation is so named because of the characteristic damage when it enters the area of action. Visually, however, it looks like a bright purple shimmer in the air.

The name is due to the effect of lifting any living thing into the air and then spinning it up to tremendous speed. The nature of the "Carousel" has not yet been fully explored. Detected by a light dust vortex and scattered body fragments around. It is very important not to miss the moment of the beginning of pulling into the anomalous vortex and not to get into the zone of maximum strong effect in the center - only then there is a chance to get away with minimal injuries.
A formation of a nature not entirely clear. On contact with the body, causes injuries similar to the effects of strong acid.

A localized concentrate of electromagnetic energy. When quiet, it appears as a dull blue-blue flicker. At the moment of actuation, it creates a disturbance of the electromagnetic field affecting any material object in the area of its action. The damaging effect of an electromagnetic pulse (EMP) is caused by induced voltages and currents in various conductors. The effect of EMI is manifested primarily in relation to electrical and radio-electronic equipment. Does not pose a threat to living things, but can severely damage all electrical appliances. EMP is most often the cause of military helicopter crashes.

One of the Zone's most inexplicable phenomena. It is not known whether this formation causes damage on contact. There is also no information regarding the artifacts produced. It's not just scientists who are trying to study the anomaly, the black market is also showing great interest. Rumor has it that the substance could give stalkers back the ability to have healthy children.

Aggressive Organics. The original source appears to have been moss. The formation does not have a permanent shape, when approached, it digs into the victim with outgrowths, causing severe damage to exposed skin areas. Scientists have not yet determined what artifacts form this anomaly.

The progenitor of this mutaflora species is not yet known to scientists. Mostly grows in densely overgrown grassy areas, so it is hard to detect. Remarkably, it is impossible to detect this anomaly with detectors. To hit small objects, such as bolts or stones anomaly is also indifferent. Only works on organic life forms. If the subject enters the target area, it instantly collapses, preventing escape. Forms "Thorn" artifacts of various kinds.

One of the Zone's most common anomalies. It represents a region of multiply increased gravity - "graviconcentrate". The type of damage is a gravity strike. Causes severe damage to internal organs, destruction of skeletal bones, and tissue tears. Depending on concentration, tears apart a trapped living creature or inflicts severe damage such as deep cuts all over the body. Forms gravitational artifacts of various types of effects. An anomalous gravitational field in a quiescent state is easily visible by a characteristic sparkle-like glow. There is a rumor among stalkers that anomalies of this type began to be fixed outside the zone. This is of no-nonsense concern to the scientific world, although there has been no confirmation of these rumors so far.

An anomalous formation about 10 meters in diameter, accumulating static electricity. A disturbed anomaly explodes with dozens of mini lightning bolts, and electrocution is almost always fatal for any living creature. A characteristic feature of the electra is the bluish mist visible above it during the day. At night, it is easily detected by any kind of detectors or by throwing metal objects.

anomalously altered vegetation. At the rapid approach of a living creature, it emits a cloud of particles, which in case of contact with open or poorly protected skin will seriously injure the latter. It does not respond to slow moving objects.

The anomaly is presumably gravitational in nature. At the moment of activation with a terrible force pulls into itself everything that is within a radius of 10-15 meters. If hit in the center of the funnel there is no chance of survival: the body of both animal and human will be compressed into a dense lump, and then torn at the moment of the so-called discharge. During the entire period of its existence - on average about a week - the anomaly does not change its location; it can be visually detected during the day by the characteristic air movement above it, swirling foliage, fragments of dismembered corpses and a characteristic dark spot on the ground in the center. Extremely dangerous at night, as it is only detected by detectors or by throwing metal objects.

A harmless gravitational anomaly that allows you to forget about the laws of gravity for a while. In a local volume with a diameter of a few meters, the Earth's gravity is greatly reduced. Forms the artifact "Film".

The name is due to the effect of lifting any living thing into the air and then spinning it up to tremendous speed. The nature of the roundabout has not yet been fully investigated. Detected by a light dust vortex and scattered body fragments around. It is very important not to miss the moment of the beginning of pulling into the anomalous vortex and not to get into the zone of maximum strong effect in the center - only then there is a chance to get away with minimal injuries.
An area of elevated levels - more than 50 mcR/h - of radiation. Prolonged exposure to such places should be avoided.

An anomaly, which can rightly be called a small miracle: in a volume with a diameter of several meters, the flow of time is repeatedly slowed down. There appears to be no negative health effects, but it is not easy to get out of it. Interestingly, at the center of the time machine is usually an artifact called Mama's Beads, upon removal of which the anomaly ceases to exist.

In an inactive state it looks like a cloud of hot air, but when any object or living creature comes into range it forms a compact area heated to a temperature of about 1500K. Can only be detected at night by powerful detectors or by throwing metal objects. Forms three types of artifacts: "Drops," "Fireball," and "Crystal."
Consists of liquid metal of anomalous origin. It is formed after emission, in contact with the body it lasts for a short time, after which it evaporates.
Cheap artifacts in the form of metal scraps and construction debris. It has no useful properties. Only of interest to researchers for radiation measurements.
Cheap artifacts in the form of metal scraps and construction debris. It has no useful properties. Only of interest to researchers for radiation measurements.
A unique artifact. The result of the interplay between Black Spiked and Meatgrinder. Rarely appears in clusters of anomalies.
Appears in clusters of anomalies. Protect against unconsciousness, restore strength, shield against psi effects.
A "springboard" anomaly is born. Such an artifact can be found in few parts of the zone.
Formed by the "Roast" anomaly at high temperatures. Externally, it looks like a blackened drop-shaped formation with a glossy surface, covered with cracks.

A super artifact of an electro-magnetic nature. A directed field of disintegration. When activated, it emits a powerful force field that instantly transforms any objects into "jelly". The origin of this thing is shrouded in a veil of scientific mystery. It is clear that it includes dielectric elements, but under what physical conditions it is formed - science does not know.
An artifact from a weak energy anomaly with no practical use.

A level two super artifact. Appear in clusters of anomalies. Has the ability to scare away monsters while attracting the controller. When panicking monsters, it loses its anomalous energy and can vaporize. anomalous energy level: very high. Cost: very high.

An artifact of transmutational origin. Has a high price tag. A viscous substance resembling a sticky mass, yet very strong. It tends to spread into crevices. Rumor has it that when this artifact is worn on the belt, it sinks into damaged areas of the suit and then solidifies there, thus patching holes and damage.

A superartefact with unstable gravity. A throwing object, after hitting the floor or an obstacle is fired at a living body. Once hit, is fired at the next living body until it falls or hits an inanimate object. After which it can be lifted.

Large flying fluff, leaves severe burns when it hits the body. It accumulates in lowlands, pits and hollows. When there is a wind or explosion, it rises into the air. A rash of "burning fluff" growths.
An outgrown case of Elektra anomaly activity. Apparently, such a wonderful rounded shape can be obtained by subjecting the anomaly to thermal stress. An expensive artifact.
The origin of this type of artifact as well as the name is shrouded in mystery. Valued amongst the explorers of the Zone.
An artifact of thermal origin. A transparent shimmering sphere.
When you hold this enigma of the Zone in your hands, you can feel your skin roughening and becoming less sensitive. It's still easy to puncture it with a bullet, but it's much harder to cut it.
Spawned by the Vortex anomaly. Elemental artifact with a directional magnetic and gravitational anomaly. Allows you to carry an additional 6 lbs.

Elemental artifact with a directional magnetic and gravitational anomaly. Has a variety with more pronounced anomalous properties - "strong gravitational artifact". Allows you to carry an extra 4 kilograms of weight.
An elemental artifact of a gravitational nature. It has the shape of a torus, which explains its name. At least two varieties of this artifact are known, the common and the "glass bagel".
An elemental artifact of organic nature. A bundle of stiff lichen fibers of a dirty rusty color. It has no useful properties. Object of Sale.

Various metal junk, which had been lying in gravitational anomalies for a long time, acquired the ability to create a directed magnetic field of high intensity. This specimen is a fragment of a gearbox toothed shaft. Magnet - A strong gravitational artifact with a strong one-sided gravitational anomaly, used to create gravity weapons and anti-gravity devices. Possesses surreal effects. Appears next to a maternal anomaly. It is not dangerous, so it can be picked up and does not necessarily need to be stored in a container. The artifact moves in every possible way: it dances and jumps up to half a meter, floats unsteadily above the ground and shakes; it can hang on the wall or ceiling, which confirms its gravitational origin. From 15-20 meters, the sound detector reacts to the artifact with a special sound. Has 1 level of anomalous energy. Allows you to carry an extra 5 pounds of weight.
Crystallizes in the Stinging Fluff anomaly. Occurs infrequently and is quite effective, which has earned it a stable price on the artifact market.

Reminiscent of 10-centimeter needles. Appear in their mother anomaly, stuck in the ground and swaying slightly. Will not fall if mounted on a point; will also stay on a point if pounded into a wall or ceiling at any angle. They are not dangerous, so they can be picked up and do not necessarily need to be stored in a container. From 3-7 meters, the detector reacts to the artifact with a special sound. Temporarily shielded from psi effects, blind dogs "lose track".

The result of the interaction between the Stinging Fluff anomaly and the body of an inattentive stalker. The spiked artifact prickles the wearer's body no matter how it is attached. Pretty common and cheap.
Very rarely found near Carousel anomalies. Only a few people manage to find such an artifact, and few people have even seen it. It has a nice shape and an equally nice price.

It is located near anomalies of the "Funnel" type. On contact with the body, it spreads directional radiation that increases endurance. Such an artifact is not difficult to find, so the money for it is not much. Allows you to carry an extra 2 kilograms of weight.

Strange terrain. If you go deeper into it, you'll come to a heavily contaminated plain. The shallow lake located there is filled to the brim with wreckage of machinery. You can also visit the old institute and the factory, but lately the military has been there too often.

The Duty group has cleared a place on the outskirts of this wild territory for their base and allows stalkers to rest here. A kind of oasis. There is a department store building that houses a stalker bar: stalkers from all over the Zone gather there. The bar is run by a local merchant, so not only can you socialize here, but you can sell-buy almost anything. To the north of the bar is the military base, to the south is the Garbage.

It's always gloomy and foggy here, and it rains often. You can get some nice artifacts in the Dark Valley, or you can quickly say goodbye to your life. There are many old stalkers here - they came here for valuable artifacts; there are also bandits. We could look for an entrance to an underground laboratory somewhere around here, but no one has ever returned from there, and no one really knows what's hiding there.

A kind of pre-bathroom of the Zone, the first place where rookies get, settling in little by little. In the cellar behind the village near the army checkpoint there is a merchant - it is useful to talk to him. It is not reasonable to go to the checkpoint and get caught by the soldiers: they have orders to shoot without warning; on the other hand, some of them are ready to instantly become friendly for money, especially if there are no superiors around. Killing soldiers is highly discouraged, except in the case of a direct threat to life.

A huge technical cemetery: mountains of radioactive junk were brought here after the first accident. There are remnants of old buildings, mutants are encountered. There are a lot of rookies here, just like at the perimeter itself - and there are gangsters hanging around, always looking for a bigger piece of the action without much hassle. You can find some artifacts, but it's better not to stay long - there are more interesting places. If you go east, you'll come to the Wild Territory; to the west is the passage to the Research Institute; to the north is the road to Stalker Bar.

An abandoned army base, an old village and a small lake. On the army base settled group Sin, religious fanatics who believe in the divine essence of the Zone, in the final redemption of mankind. According to the Barkeep about two weeks ago all the PDAs of the stalkers of this group went offline, since then nothing has been heard from them. All stalkers who approached their base disappeared. Either this group no longer exists, and something has settled there and is destroying everyone who comes near, or they've completely lost their minds and the Sinners are attacking everyone.
Mutant City. Home of controllers, bloodsuckers, and zombie armies. Packs of various mutants are born here. It's impossible to eliminate everyone, the only thing left is stealthy movements

Everyone exposed to the antenna is zombified. The resulting zombies wander towards the antenna, where they die over time from starvation, radiation, or aggression from other zombies. The approaches are strewn with dead bodies, and zombified mutants and stalkers roam the neighborhood, occasionally fighting each other.

It was a rather large factory, of which now only ruins remain. A lot of stalkers found their end in them: all sorts of unclean things have spread there, as if they converge there from all over the Zone. Rumor has it, though, that there is something very important at this plant, so there are always plenty of people willing to try their luck.

A former nuclear power plant that everyone has heard of at least once. This is the heart of the Zone. If legends are to be believed, somewhere out there is some thing that can fulfill any wish - it's called the Monolith.

The lake has several islands of piled industrial debris and dilapidated buildings. Stone hulks stick out of the poisonous water. The lake is dead, nothing can live in it, getting into the lake causes severe acid burns. Rubber boots can be used to walk in shallow depths. There are several large islands of trash and building hulks in the center of the lake. They are accessed by several trails through shallow water. The largest one has a descent into an unflooded basement.

There have been anonymous reports of strange phenomena being noticed in the inner ten-kilometer zone.
A notoriety is growing around Pripyat - strange animals have appeared on the nighttime streets of the forgotten city. The first missing persons reports are coming in.
After a bus carrying foreign tourists went missing in Pripyat, the zone was closed to visitors. Several lengthy investigations were inconclusive. There is no doubt - the bus has vaporized in the city, but further investigation yields nothing.
Locals brought the dead body of a strange animal covered with red hair to the checkpoint. The mutated creature had a humanoid build, small stature, and large black eyes. The mutant has been taken. A few days later, the newspapers in the capital refuted the numerous rumors that the found corpse belonged to an escaped monkey of one of the maintenance chiefs.

Chernobyl Scientific Research Institute of Parapsychology (NIIP). It is the central research building of the former Union. The various departments are scattered throughout the former USSR. From where research material was regularly sourced. The main goals are the study and development of human paranormal abilities. The priority is to work out a new concept of relations between a person and the state. Creation of a new society based on the common consciousness of the laboring masses. A new level of collectivism - a full-blown collective intelligence that encompasses all areas of human endeavor and includes all citizens of allied countries.

In the footsteps of desperate lone stalkers for large-scale study of the Zone again take scientific expeditions. However, inside the perimeter guarded by the army, there are already many unaccounted for individuals - right down to poachers and bandits. In the bulk of stalkers travel through the Zone in search of a variety of anomalous formations - the so-called artifacts, for which often earn good money.
Rumors emerged among the local population that Chernobyl was a battery of secret government laboratories. The explosion was due to overloading during the experiment.
A bizarre artifact shaped like a spiral.
You can't sleep when your enemies are around

Most of the information is encrypted. Just the latest message from the Professor: The lab has an exit to the lower levels of the cordon, but the entrance to it is reportedly closed from the inside. If possible, verify this information after you take the measurements.
PDA of a military stalker with the call sign Blue 9. Blocked. Maybe someone can decipher it.

Note in the margin: Personally in hand.\nOn your order, a shipment of gas masks and work clothes has been transferred to the lower levels of the workshops. A total of 140 pieces, plus boxes of specialty weights for your job. We have one access from the plant to your area, and I know the access code to the anteroom. Code 2565, I'll remind you. Further passage is not available to us. We're not going to ask too many questions, but still, Mr. Petrov. Why do you have wagons coming to you? They come from the city, pass under the lake, and come to you. Get it right, we don't stick our nose where it doesn't belong, but I don't want to risk my position... I hope to meet you in person where we can discuss things more specifically.
Experimental prototype for PSI radiation scanning. To work, you need to point the device at the object, and activate it.

Shit... I had to get so screwed up. the winds of madness must surely be around here somewhere...
didn't need to go straight to the base of those nutcases...
just to get out...
needs to catch the time...
notice the chance...
A prototype device radiating from psi radiation. The operation is unstable, failures may occur.

...The 4 in charge lie in a state of induced coma, and if I'm not mistaken, they control everything that happens in the zone...\nNote: Gunslinger knew the code to enter the lab... maybe it's still in the stash on Roztec...
A modification of a scientific suit with active radiation protection. Removes radiation from the owner's body when in good technical condition.
A device that allows you to shield certain types of psi attacks from a controller. Protects against the fatal effects of phantom formations.
A device that registers in the PDA the presence of mutants with psi activity.

A thick folder in which, surprisingly, all the sheets stayed in place intact. The title page bears the title, "documentation for a defense device for protection in high psi background" and the state seal." On the following pages, in neat and even handwriting, there are notes in simple pencil, the author of which insistently advised to reduce the power consumption of the main unit, which, according to him, will affect the increased mobility of the protection device. Taped to the last page are two envelopes with letters to the head of the ZX-16 science lab. In the first, the addressee requests to test a psi-defense device in the field. A village on the outskirts of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone was chosen as one of the test sites. The second letter gives a detailed report on the success of the trials.

A shredded file of documents. Many of the pages inside are missing. After reading the little that survived, we can safely conclude that it describes the principle of operation of the psi-visor, an experimental device of the new generation for survival in the dangerous environment of the Zone. The Psi-Visor is required to search for mobile sources of psi radiation, i.e., psionic beings. Unlike humans, psionic beings have their own unique rhythm of brain activity that is not yet fully understood by modern science. The device scans the area for rhythmic bioelectric brain activity and informs its owner of the psionic's presence.

An old folder covered in a layer of dust. The yellowed pages have a schematic of an anti-radiation protective spacesuit and instructions for its use. The documentation says that the spacesuits of this limited series arrived at the laboratory from the Radiation Safety Research Institute earlier than scheduled, so they have not yet undergone all the necessary tests. Among the advantages: a closed breathing system and a new-generation insulation coating that can partially stop the flow of hot particles. From the disadvantages: low mobility due to the weight of oxygen tanks behind the back, low resistance to mechanical damage. There are notes in the appendix of the documentation, in which it is stated that a new version of the anti-radiation spacesuit has been created, in the design of which all the disadvantages of the previous samples have been corrected.

Documentation for an experimental software package that is being built into the PDAs of expeditionary units of military stalkers. It was found near one such group in the dungeons of the MedPribor Research Institute. Their devices have been smashed to pieces and can no longer function, so they are of little value. The documentation says that the complex allows you to scan the area around its owner in a radius of 50 meters for the presence of other devices, read, analyze and display the resulting information about the stalker who owns them. Based on this data, a picture is drawn of the stalker's affiliation with certain groups, his reputation in the stalker community, or his approximate relationship to the owner of the visual detector.
Disintegrator artifact activator. Can activate the active particles of an artifact, turning it into jelly.

A special battery is required for operation.
